Title: Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS

You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.




You get even more bonus points if …

You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER

We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:

A natural affinity for data analysis, with experience in using SAS EG and SQL to capture and transform data.
Strong proficiency in Excel.
Expertise in data analytics tools, enabling you to easily create ad hoc queries, reports, and dashboards.
A passion for identifying key data, understanding it thoroughly, and analyzing it to answer business questions and provide valuable insights and recommendations.

Preferred:

Experience with Power BI or Tableau is a plus.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Job Description

We believe that clothes — and how you make them — can make a difference.

Since 1853, we’ve been passionate about innovation to meet people’s needs. We invented the first blue jean. And we reinvented khaki pants. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines for our manufacturing partners. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do.

A company doesn’t last 160 years by standing still. It endures by reinventing itself, striving to delight its consumers, winning in the marketplace, and by remaining true to its values. We employ more than 17,000 people around the world – supporting great brands, including Levi’s®, Dockers® and Denizen®. Our employees are committed to progress, authenticity and collaboration.

We're seeking for a motivated, data-driven Intern to join us at the Analytics team in Brussels for our Merchandising Planning and Inventory Management (MPIM) Department.

About The Job


Being point of contact for analytics and data inquiries
Creating data pipelines, dashboards and reports for use across Europe’s business
Cooperating with cross-functional partners to reach resolutions on data topics and build data products
Performing data wrangling and exploration in support of predictive modelling
Providing assistance to the extended team


About You


You have excellent analytical and communication/presentation skills
You hold a Degree in Statistics / Mathematics / Engineering / Operational research / Econometrics
You have knowledge in SQL and/or R/Python
Self-motivated, problem solver, team player
Organized with meticulous attention to detail, ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
You are flexible and able to perform in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable learning new tools. (Dataiku, Tableau, Excel, SAS etc.)


Start date: Asap for 6 months renewable.

What We Offer


Great work experience in an international, energetic and fun environment
Great opportunity to work for the world’s number one denim brand
Great compensation


LOCATION

Zaventem, Belgium

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join Revpanda.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data related to revenue, client, player behavior, registrations, FTD (First-Time Depositors), payback, and marketing efforts. Your insights will support strategic decisions and optimize our marketing and operational strategies.







Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Analysis: Gather, process, and analyze data from various sources, including player behavior, registration, FTD, payback, and marketing and financial campaigns.
Reporting & Dashboards: Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.
Insights & Recommendations: Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in the data, providing actionable insights and recommendations to improve business outcomes.
Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, product development, and operational teams to understand their data needs and deliver relevant insights.
Market Analysis: Conduct market and competitor analysis to identify opportunities for growth and optimization.
Data Integrity: Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and validation processes.
Visualization: Create clear and effective data visualizations to communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.







Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the iGaming, digital marketing, or related industries.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as SQL, Excel, Looker Studio, Power BI, or similar.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization techniques.
Familiarity with digital marketing metrics and iGaming industry trends.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics).
Experience with A/B testing and data-driven experimentation.




What we offer:

Friendly and supportive colleagues
Diverse opportunities for professional growth and career development
Possibility to take part in international conferences and online courses
Competitive salary
Birthday day off
"Refer a friend" bonus
Corporate events
LinkedIn Learning complimentary access

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a motivated freelance Data Analyst with a strong passion for data analytics to contribute significantly to the future of high-quality reporting on behalf of a prominent public government client. This role will focus on integrating, merging, and ensuring robust data governance that aligns with CSRD guidelines and requirements.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse data sources by identifying the origin, understanding the source systems, and defining the correct interpretation of the data.
Define methodologies for collecting data from various source systems and integrating it into the central data platform.
Develop and define the data model and key data assets, using the established rules set by the Data Steward to ensure accurate calculations and aggregation of the data.
Ensure data is well-structured, harmonized, and meets quality assurance standards.
Collaborate closely with the development, reporting, and business teams to guarantee accurate and timely data collection and reporting.
Define frameworks for reporting key indicators in compliance with CSRD requirements.
Establish processes to maintain consistent data quality across the platform.
Input and maintain all relevant information in the data catalogue to ensure proper data governance.




Qualifications and Skills:




Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., environmental science, sustainability, data analytics).
Experience in data analysis, reporting, and data governance.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Proficiency in Dutch or French or English




The Offer:

Hybrid working in Brussels
Long-term freelance contract
Up to €600 per day (DOE)
Start date ASAP







Work Environment:




Become part of an agile and dynamic team that serves as a vital link between the data, business, and IT functions. Enjoy a diverse work routine that actively contributes to broader organisational objectives. The initial onboarding will take place at the Brussels office, followed by a transition to a hybrid working model as you integrate fully into the team.

Title: Junior Data Analyst | MySQL & PowerBI (1y contract | Remote)
HTML:
iubenda is a legal-tech scale-up founded in 2011, now trusted by over 110K clients in the EU, the US, and 100+ more Countries. We are leaders in our industry and operate on a global scale developing and releasing innovative tech solutions.
Our mission is to provide our clients with everything their business needs - to be compliant with legal, local, and regional requirements; so that they can focus on their core product. Recently, we have undertaken a new thrilling adventure, joining forces with team.blue (a worldwide leader in digital enablement). If you're excited to work at a company in a scaling-up environment providing SaaS solutions to ~1M users - and equally important - to join a team of friendly people with a culture based on continuous learning, transparency, and collaboration. Then, you're looking at the right place!

Your mission

We're looking for an enthusiastic Junior Data Analyst to join our Finance Team and be responsible for providing support in business KPIs optimization, and systems reconciliation. Will be in charge of:

  • Collection and analyses of data coming from different systems (i.e., data warehouse, databases, and web apps);
  • Drafting reports, presentations, and business analyses related also, but not only, to web analytics services through BI tools;
  • Taking care of churn and retention analysis, funnel optimization, A/B testing, customer scoring, and predictive modeling;
  • Interacting with different teams, especially the Software Development and Accounting ones.

Requirements


  • At least 1 year of experience in a similar role;
  • Sound knowledge of MySQL;
  • Sound knowledge of PowerBI or Tableau (aimed at creating and managing dashboards);
  • Good Excel skills (i.e., complex formulas and visual charts);
  • Familiarity with general economics concepts;
  • Full professional proficiency in English.

Added values


  • Familiarity with statistics, predictive models, and AI tools (such as ChatGPT, Gemini, etc.);
  • Sound knowledge of Python language (aimed at MySQL connections, CSV imports, connections with external sources, data processing, and data visualization);
  • Good knowledge of marketing tools such as Heap.io, Funnel.io, or similar (aimed at extracting data and creating and managing dashboards);
  • Proactive and willing to provide ideas and propose improvements;
  • Previous experience in a SaaS company.

Location

At iubenda we believe in full-remote. Accordingly, you will be completely free and entitled to work from wherever you prefer in the world. At the same time in case you prefer to work from an office, at your disposal you have our Italian (Milan and Bologna) and German (Berlin and Hamburg) offices, to allow you to follow a hybrid work model.

Benefits

REMOTE WORK - You can work 100% remotely or if you prefer, from one of our beautiful offices in Italy (Bologna and Milan), and Germany (Hamburg). We are used and fully structured to onboard people who prefer to work full-time remotely.
TRAVEL ALLOWANCE TO VISIT A COLLEAGUE - We'll provide you with a budget so that you can spend time with your teammates based on the other side of the world;
COMPANY RETREATS AND COWORKING GATHERINGS - Once a year, we get together in amazing destinations to work, bond, and enjoy team-building activities. We offer fully paid week-long gatherings to places like Venice, Sicily, and the Dolomites.
LEARNING BUDGET - We'll sponsor your professional growth by providing a budget for certifications, events, courses, and books;
ENGLISH CLASSES - We offer online English classes weekly, within working hours, and on several different levels. We know there's always room to improve;
WORK EQUIPMENT - We'll provide an equipment allowance so that you can perform at your best;
BRIGHT & COLLABORATIVE WORK ENVIRONMENT - You will be part of a multicultural team of talented and experienced colleagues. Along with that, you will find a team spirit, which you would rarely find elsewhere!
By applying, you hereby declare that you have read and understood our privacy policy (https://www.iubenda.com/privacy-policy/96274994).

Please send your CV in English.
Want to know more about iubenda? Check us out at:
iubenda.com | LinkedIn | Facebook |Twitter

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A leading financial institution is undergoing a digital transformation to deliver user-friendly digital capabilities. As a Data Analyst, you will be pivotal in the Data Delivery function, focusing on Finance, Compliance, and Risk. You will collaborate with Tech Leads, Data Engineers, BI developers, and Product Owners to ensure successful data product deliveries on a hybrid platform using AWS, Informatica, and Oracle technologies.




Key Responsibilities

Perform solution and impact analysis, define implementation and validation approaches.
Analyze data and processes to define functional and technical requirements.
Coordinate with data engineers and source systems for successful integration.
Support testing and validation activities to ensure data quality and compliance.




Competency Profile

Strong understanding of banking processes and experience in managing data requirements.
Proven experience with data analysis, mapping, and SQL for data validation.
Ability to translate business needs into technical requirements and specifications.
Experience working with Data Warehouses, ETL processes, and large-scale data systems.
Familiarity with AWS technologies (S3, Redshift) and cloud-based analytics platforms.
Experience with agile frameworks, preferably SAFe.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a structured and organized approach.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
bpostgroup strives to create an inclusive environment with challenging projects and inspiring collaborations. With our employees at the heart of our organization, we don’t believe in jobs, we believe in careers. We're now looking for a senior reporting analist who will make us move. ​

​

Your mission:

The Senior Reporting Analyst plays a key role in the follow-up and evaluation of bpost’s operational activities, by providing accurate up-to-date data in the form of dashboards, operational reports and end-to-end scorecards, thus enabling field teams to quickly take corrective actions where needed, helping performance controllers to keep budget and operations under control and providing business leaders the necessary foundation to take pertinent decisions for bpost’s roadmap.

Advanced knowledge is required both on backend IT systems to ensure smooth and reliable wrangling of data coming from massive data sources, as well as modern frontend reporting interfaces to present the data in a sleek, fit-for-use and fit-for-purpose jacket.

He/she will support, collaborate and build long lasting relationships with internal key stakeholders, continuously looking for and propose new ideas for potential improvements.

This role requires high organization and communication skills, the ability to work in teams or fly solo, and to manage multiple projects simultaneously. He/she should be able to continue to work meticulously under pressure at peak times, and be agile to work in an environment where change happens at a rapid pace.

​

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

​

· Understand business processes and assist the customer in finding the right solution for his problem

· Deliver quality analytic reports in timely fashion

· Familiarize oneself with the various data marts’ contents

· Follow up data projects from A to Z as pm, starting from Business Requirements to the final result including after care.

· Develop and manage flexible data extract solutions that allow effortless and reliable continuity

· Maximize the automation of report generation

· Build reports in a standardized and harmonized way (share with other teams)

· Ensure data quality by adding consistency checks to the reports

· Participate in test & QA phases of new releases and propose measurement data sets

· Continue to develop and simplify the reporting process and increase its efficiency

· Identify & analyze recurring issues and propose solutions

· Keep up-to-date with the latest technologies at hand

· Be or become the Subject Matter Expert of a set of channels/products and act as SPOC within the team

· Present new reports to the relevant internal customers

​

​Your profile:​​

We do not only deliver letters and parcels, but also opportunities. This job is open to all with diverse backgrounds and talents, possessing the following skills: ​

​

· A talented colleague with strong analytical and communication skills who picks things up quickly, has an eye for detail and likes to make things happen.

· You embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment and thrive well in a team environment, taking others along on your growth journey.

​

· You have 3-7 years’ experience in analyzing business needs and translating them into clear reports, using mainstream and new data manipulation and reporting tools such as:

o MS Excel

o Visualisation (PowerBi)

o SAP Business Objects

o SQL

o ETL_Tool (Knime; Access)

o Programming languages (VBA; DAX; M; Perl)

· Expertise in similar tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, …) is considered as an asset. Knowledge of other programming languages is considered as an asset as well (Python) even as experience in a logistics environment.

· You speak fluent Dutch or French and understand the other language, and have business knowledge of English.

​

Our offer: ​

Like a long-awaited parcel, we want to make you feel welcome and valued. Our offer includes: ​

· Competitive monthly salary​

· Meal vouchers​

· Hospitalization-, group- and disability insurances​

· 20 days of statutory leave and 7 additional extralegal days off ​

· An end-of-year and performance-based bonus and double holiday pay ​

· Many benefits from more than 100 bpost-partners​

​

Why bpostgroup?​

bpostgroup is Belgium's leading postal operator and a growing parcel & omni-commerce logistics partner globally. With a focus on social and environmental sustainability, we aim to be a trusted guide in a changing world. As our newest team member you will: ​

· Become part of the bpostgroup family with a unique atmosphere and culture.​

· Enjoy a dynamic work environment with a hybrid model allowing for flexibility.​

· Have access to continuous learning and development opportunities.​

· Have a direct impact on decision-making in an international success story.​

· Thrive in a leadership culture centered on visioning, sense making, innovation, and relating, empowering you to lead effectively in our forward-thinking organization.​

​

Find out more about bpostgroup​​

​

No match? ​

Explore other exciting job opportunities with us.​

​

More info? ​

Feel free to reach out to Marissa Sorgeloos

​

Your mission:

The Senior Reporting Analyst plays a key role in the follow-up and evaluation of bpost’s operational activities, by providing accurate up-to-date data in the form of dashboards, operational reports and end-to-end scorecards, thus enabling field teams to quickly take corrective actions where needed, helping performance controllers to keep budget and operations under control and providing business leaders the necessary foundation to take pertinent decisions for bpost’s roadmap.

Advanced knowledge is required both on backend IT systems to ensure smooth and reliable wrangling of data coming from massive data sources, as well as modern frontend reporting interfaces to present the data in a sleek, fit-for-use and fit-for-purpose jacket.

He/she will support, collaborate and build long lasting relationships with internal key stakeholders, continuously looking for and propose new ideas for potential improvements.

This role requires high organization and communication skills, the ability to work in teams or fly solo, and to manage multiple projects simultaneously. He/she should be able to continue to work meticulously under pressure at peak times, and be agile to work in an environment where change happens at a rapid pace.

​

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

​

· Understand business processes and assist the customer in finding the right solution for his problem

· Deliver quality analytic reports in timely fashion

· Familiarize oneself with the various data marts’ contents

· Follow up data projects from A to Z as pm, starting from Business Requirements to the final result including after care.

· Develop and manage flexible data extract solutions that allow effortless and reliable continuity

· Maximize the automation of report generation

· Build reports in a standardized and harmonized way (share with other teams)

· Ensure data quality by adding consistency checks to the reports

· Participate in test & QA phases of new releases and propose measurement data sets

· Continue to develop and simplify the reporting process and increase its efficiency

· Identify & analyze recurring issues and propose solutions

· Keep up-to-date with the latest technologies at hand

· Be or become the Subject Matter Expert of a set of channels/products and act as SPOC within the team

· Present new reports to the relevant internal customers

​

​Your profile:​​

We do not only deliver letters and parcels, but also opportunities. This job is open to all with diverse backgrounds and talents, possessing the following skills: ​

​

· A talented colleague with strong analytical and communication skills who picks things up quickly, has an eye for detail and likes to make things happen.

· You embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment and thrive well in a team environment, taking others along on your growth journey.

​

· You have 3-7 years’ experience in analyzing business needs and translating them into clear reports, using mainstream and new data manipulation and reporting tools such as:

o MS Excel

o Visualisation (PowerBi)

o SAP Business Objects

o SQL

o ETL_Tool (Knime; Access)

o Programming languages (VBA; DAX; M; Perl)

· Expertise in similar tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, …) is considered as an asset. Knowledge of other programming languages is considered as an asset as well (Python) even as experience in a logistics environment.

· You speak fluent Dutch or French and understand the other language, and have business knowledge of English.

​

Our offer: ​

Like a long-awaited parcel, we want to make you feel welcome and valued. Our offer includes: ​

· Competitive monthly salary​

· Meal vouchers​

· Hospitalization-, group- and disability insurances​

· 20 days of statutory leave and 7 additional extralegal days off ​

· An end-of-year and performance-based bonus and double holiday pay ​

· Many benefits from more than 100 bpost-partners​

​

Why bpostgroup?​

bpostgroup is Belgium's leading postal operator and a growing parcel & omni-commerce logistics partner globally. With a focus on social and environmental sustainability, we aim to be a trusted guide in a changing world. As our newest team member you will: ​

· Become part of the bpostgroup family with a unique atmosphere and culture.​

· Enjoy a dynamic work environment with a hybrid model allowing for flexibility.​

· Have access to continuous learning and development opportunities.​

· Have a direct impact on decision-making in an international success story.​

· Thrive in a leadership culture centered on visioning, sense making, innovation, and relating, empowering you to lead effectively in our forward-thinking organization.​

​

Find out more about bpostgroup​​

​

No match? ​

Explore other exciting job opportunities with us.​

​

More info? ​

Feel free to reach out to Marissa Sorgeloos

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

You’re an original. So are we.

We’re a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labour and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.

Where we lead, others follow. For nearly 170 years, we’ve used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world. We employ more than 15,000 people globally to support our great brands: Levi’s®, Dockers®, Denizen®, Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.™ and Beyond Yoga.

Levi’s is looking for a Data Analyst and Data Visualization Expert to support the LSE merchandise and inventory management data analytics team. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools.

Who We Are Looking For

You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations, You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.

About The Job


Conduct analysis on complex retail data. Measure and track data created by data products, and convert them to key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve data quality, data analysis and business debugging.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.


About You


3+ years of professional experience analyzing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Looker and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Google BigQuery, MSsql, dbt)
Experience with data integration tools such as Dataiku or Data Fusion is a plus
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarize, and analyze data.
Hands on experience working with big data such as sales, inventory management, planning etc. retail knowledge is a plus
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.


LOCATION

Zaventem, Belgium

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Skills and Experience

A combination of several of the below should be covered:

• 5+ years of Business Analysis in a data context (ability to use SQL and advanced excel to analyse and manipulate extracted data to form conclusiions and/or inform design decisions)

• 3+ years awareness / experience of Data Architecture, Data Modelling & Data Engineering (including data modelling tools such as ERWIN)

• 3+ Years Hands on experience of data dictionary, lineage and management tools & concepts – especially Collibra (training will also be provided)

• 2+ Years of Microsoft PowerBI Development to create reports / dashboards that visually articulate KPI and other meaningful information.

• 3+ full software development lifecycle product launches including warranty support and handover to operationalisation team

• Awareness of PowerShell capabilities (to inform designs) for automating tasks and processes in a Windows Operating System environment.

• Awareness of SQL (on SQL Server and other databases), especially in regards to the capability of Stored Procedures to extract, load & transform database objects.

• Understanding Logical Access Management and Privileged Access Management & Controls

• Knowledge and experience with Sailpoint and CyberArk is highly beneficial.

• Knowledge of other database technologies (e.g. Oracle) is a bonus

• Familiarity with, or awareness of, security mechanisms in use across operating platforms and applications such as Windows, Linux, z/OS (RACF), Tandem, SQL Server, Oracle, DB2, CyberArk, PowerBroker (Beyond Trust), ServiceNow.

• Understanding of access control and management principles (e.g. segregation of duty, toxic pairs etc.)

• Professional certification in CISSP, CISM and CISA, or equivalent is a plus

Title: Sales Data Analyst (m/f/*)
Description:
Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with curious, creative 3Mers.





The Impact You’ll Make in this Rol

eAs a Business Analyst, you will be part of the Consumer Business Group, responsible for the commercialization of worldwide leading brands including Scotch®, Scotch Blue™, Command™, Scotch-Brite™, Post-it®, 3M, Futuro™, Nexcare™, among others and you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world

.Here, you will make an impact by

:Determining Advanced Analysis and Insight Generation: Leveraging retailers and distributors' point of sales (POS) data, syndicated data, and shopper data to generate actionable insights
.Driving POS Growth and Mitigating Declines: Utilize your analytical expertise to develop strategies that enhance POS growth, while identifying and addressing potential declines through effective category management
.Playing a pivotal role in executing category management strategies. This involves deep dives into category performance, identifying growth opportunities, optimizing product assortment, and providing guidance on pricing and promotional strategies
.Influencing Partnership with Key Accounts: Build and maintain strong relationships with retailer/distributor key accounts within EMEA, influencing decision-making through data-driven insights and category management expertise
.Collaborating with all business analysts to implement Consumer Business Group global analytic strategies and tactics, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives




.
Your Skills and Experti

seTo set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualification

s:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or higher from an accredited institution preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related fiel
d.Expert Experience in business analytics or a related relevant customer market with a preference for experience in the FMCG industr
y.Category Management demonstrated expertise and data-driven decision makin
g.Language Proficiency: Fluent in French AND English is a mu
stCommunication Skills: Excellent storytelling and presentation skills, capable of translating complex data into actionable insights. Proficiency in presenting to client




s.
Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role inclu

de:Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and data interpretation skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Power
BI.Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with planogramming software (e.g., JDA Space Planner), and an understanding of data modeling techniqu
es.Leadership Qualities: Proven leadership skills with the ability to influence key stakeholders and drive implementation of strategic initiativ




es.
Supporting Your Well-b

eing3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and sc




ope.

Title: Data analyst (BI)
Description:
Omschrijving

De eindgebruiker wordt ondersteund in het lezen en begrijpen van de aangeleverde rapporten. Het team staat eveneens in voor het actueel en beschikbaar houden van de gebruikte infrastructuur en software.

Verantwoordelijkheidsdomein 1::

Het implementeren van adequate en innovatieve oplossingen op het gebied van de technische infrastructuur om aan de verwachtingen van de klant te voldoen. Bijhorende taken o.a. zijn:


Analyseren van de vraag van de klant en het identificeren van de huidige en toekomstige noden.
Opzetten en analyseren van de verschillende technische infrastructuurvoorstellen die ook voldoen aan de huidige normen.
Rekening houden met elementen zoals continuïteit, veiligheid, performantie en beschikbaarheid
De documentatie opstellen en de controlepunten opstellen/valideren



Verantwoordelijkheidsdomein 2:

Bijdragen aan het operationeel beheer van de infrastructuur zodat de continuïteit van de dienst verzekerd wordt.

Bijhorende taken o.a. zijn:


Nagaan of de technische infrastructuren goed werken
De change requests uitvoeren



Profiel


Hogere opleiding (Master of Bachelor) met technische/engineering achtergrond of gelijkwaardig door ervaring met ICT- technologie waarvoor expertise gevraagd wordt
Je kan met BI tools (PowerBI, Oracle BI) overweg en SQL heeft geen geheimen voor jou.
Kennis van XML, sterschema's



Noodzakelijke gedragscompetenties:


Communicatief
Probleemoplossend vermogen
Analytische vaardigheden
Zelfstandig kunnen werken
Teamspeler
Creatief
Innovatie gericht
Presentatie vaardigheden



Aanbod

Je word deel van een groeiende KMO met ruimte voor initiatief en persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Wij zorgen ervoor dat je in een uitdagende maar aangename werkomgeving terecht komt met leuke collega's. Samen met jou stippelen we een carriereplan uit, met aandacht en budget voor bijkomende opleidingingen / certificaties. Je kan rekenen op een motiverend salaris, aangevuld met extralegale voordelen, inclusief bedrijfswagen (of alternatieve vergoeding).

(Freelance ook mogelijk)

you like to make queries in SQL

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Je komt terecht in de marketing tribe bij Telenet Business, de dynamische en groeiende B2B-circle binnen de Telenet groep. Nu B2B steeds meer datagedreven wordt, speel jij een cruciale rol in het overnemen van deze mindset en het verschaffen van de juiste inzichten. Je maakt deel uit van een klein dynamisch team dat verantwoordelijk is voor marketing intelligence, marketing automation, digital marketing en performance. De data analist werkt zeer nauw samen met de marketing collega's, zijn data analist collega's, data scientists maar ook met sales, solutions experts, business analisten.

Jouw rol als data analist


Als data analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het beheersen van commerciële data, zorg je ervoor dat deze door jou of andere collega's wordt opgeschoond en ondersteun je stakeholders met interessante business inzichten. Als je houdt van een verscheidenheid aan dataprojecten, in een complex datalandschap en om samen te werken met een veelheid aan stakeholders, dan ben jij onze persoon!
Je verzamelt, cleaned en valideert de gegevens die je nodig hebt uit verschillende bronnen.
Stelt klantenlijsten op, combineert relevante klant- en productgegevens om leadgeneratieacties, migraties en marketingacties voor te bereiden.
Zorg ervoor dat we de meest optimale gegevenskwaliteit in onze contacten hebben
Bepaal gegevensverbeteringen om ervoor te zorgen dat we de gegevenskwaliteit op peil houden en het beste halen uit de gegevens die we verzamelen
Stuur het commerciële team aan door bedrijfsinzichten en meer specifieke segmentinzichten te bieden. Ondersteun de business door nieuwe kansen te definiëren op basis van diepgaande data-analyse, suggesties om de prestaties te verbeteren, etc.
Creëer in Qlik nieuwe rapporten ter ondersteuning van zakelijke inzichten voor commerciële sturing.
Zorg ervoor dat we voldoen aan het GDPR-beleid van Telenet met betrekking tot B2B-klantgegevens.


We zijn op zoek naar een Data Analist met de volgende vaardigheden


Data-driven mindset met het vermogen om de juiste inhoudelijke KPI's vast te stellen en deze op te volgen.
Strong analytical and data skills, met kennis van Excel, SQL, SPSS en/of rapportageplatform. Ervaring met QlikSense is een voordeel.
Op je gemak zijn in een complexe omgeving met meerdere te beheren tools/bronnen
Samenwerken met een veelheid aan stakeholders van verschillende afdelingen binnen B2B
Goede presentatie- en vertelvaardigheden, zeker naar niet-data gedreven collega's
Een probleemoplossende en resultaatgerichte mindset
Uitstekende communicatie- en samenwerkingsvaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels, Frans is een pré.
Ervaring van minimaal 3-5 jaar als data/business/CRM-analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.


Wat kun je van ons verwachten?


Je komt terecht bij een bedrijf en een team die veel in je investeren en je werkomgeving waar mogelijk aanpassen aan je behoeften. We willen dat je jezelf ontwikkelt en zorgen tegelijkertijd voor een goede balans tussen werk en privé.
Je krijgt alle kansen om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen. We stimuleren je persoonlijke groei met interne mobiliteitsmogelijkheden en uitgebreide leermogelijkheden, maar geven je ook de kans om desgewenst op de pauzeknop te drukken of een heel ander pad in te slaan.
Een afwisselende baan waarin je tastbare resultaten zult boeken en je stempel zult drukken.
Een competitief bruto maandsalaris dat we aanvullen met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals kortingen op Telenet producten, maaltijdcheques, ... .
Een geweldig team van collega's die net zo gepassioneerd zijn als jij.
Je komt te werken in een geweldige moderne werkplek op Telenet HQ in Mechelen met de mogelijkheid om tot drie dagen per week thuis te werken
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Je komt terecht in de marketing tribe bij Telenet Business, de dynamische en groeiende B2B-circle binnen de Telenet groep. Nu B2B steeds meer datagedreven wordt, speel jij een cruciale rol in het overnemen van deze mindset en het verschaffen van de juiste inzichten. Je maakt deel uit van een klein dynamisch team dat verantwoordelijk is voor marketing intelligence, marketing automation, digital marketing en performance. De data analist werkt zeer nauw samen met de marketing collega's, zijn data analist collega's, data scientists maar ook met sales, solutions experts, business analisten.

Jouw rol als data analist

  • Als data analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het beheersen van commerciële data, zorg je ervoor dat deze door jou of andere collega's wordt opgeschoond en ondersteun je stakeholders met interessante business inzichten. Als je houdt van een verscheidenheid aan dataprojecten, in een complex datalandschap en om samen te werken met een veelheid aan stakeholders, dan ben jij onze persoon!
  • Je verzamelt, cleaned en valideert de gegevens die je nodig hebt uit verschillende bronnen.
  • Stelt klantenlijsten op, combineert relevante klant- en productgegevens om leadgeneratieacties, migraties en marketingacties voor te bereiden.
  • Zorg ervoor dat we de meest optimale gegevenskwaliteit in onze contacten hebben
  • Bepaal gegevensverbeteringen om ervoor te zorgen dat we de gegevenskwaliteit op peil houden en het beste halen uit de gegevens die we verzamelen
  • Stuur het commerciële team aan door bedrijfsinzichten en meer specifieke segmentinzichten te bieden. Ondersteun de business door nieuwe kansen te definiëren op basis van diepgaande data-analyse, suggesties om de prestaties te verbeteren, etc.
  • Creëer in Qlik nieuwe rapporten ter ondersteuning van zakelijke inzichten voor commerciële sturing.
  • Zorg ervoor dat we voldoen aan het GDPR-beleid van Telenet met betrekking tot B2B-klantgegevens.

We zijn op zoek naar een Data Analist met de volgende vaardigheden

  • Data-driven mindset met het vermogen om de juiste inhoudelijke KPI's vast te stellen en deze op te volgen.
  • Strong analytical and data skills, met kennis van Excel, SQL, SPSS en/of rapportageplatform. Ervaring met QlikSense is een voordeel.
  • Op je gemak zijn in een complexe omgeving met meerdere te beheren tools/bronnen
  • Samenwerken met een veelheid aan stakeholders van verschillende afdelingen binnen B2B
  • Goede presentatie- en vertelvaardigheden, zeker naar niet-data gedreven collega's
  • Een probleemoplossende en resultaatgerichte mindset
  • Uitstekende communicatie- en samenwerkingsvaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels, Frans is een pré.
  • Ervaring van minimaal 3-5 jaar als data/business/CRM-analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.

Wat kun je van ons verwachten?

  • Je komt terecht bij een bedrijf en een team die veel in je investeren en je werkomgeving waar mogelijk aanpassen aan je behoeften. We willen dat je jezelf ontwikkelt en zorgen tegelijkertijd voor een goede balans tussen werk en privé.
  • Je krijgt alle kansen om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen. We stimuleren je persoonlijke groei met interne mobiliteitsmogelijkheden en uitgebreide leermogelijkheden, maar geven je ook de kans om desgewenst op de pauzeknop te drukken of een heel ander pad in te slaan.
  • Een afwisselende baan waarin je tastbare resultaten zult boeken en je stempel zult drukken.
  • Een competitief bruto maandsalaris dat we aanvullen met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals kortingen op Telenet producten, maaltijdcheques, ... .
  • Een geweldig team van collega's die net zo gepassioneerd zijn als jij.
  • Je komt te werken in een geweldige moderne werkplek op Telenet HQ in Mechelen met de mogelijkheid om tot drie dagen per week thuis te werken

Title: Data Analyst – Data Management & Analytics
Description:
Capco – The Future. Now.

Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We are dedicated to fully supporting our clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking, Capital Markets, Finance Risk & Compliance, Insurance, and Wealth and Investment Management. Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com

Let’s Talk About You

You want to Own Your Career. You’re serious about rising as far and as fast as your work and achievements can take you. And you’re ready to write the next chapter of your career story: a challenging and rewarding role as a Capco Data analyst Consultant.

Let’s Get Down To Business

We are looking for a data Consultant to join our Data team.

Responsibilities


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Show Us What You’ve Got

It will be very useful if you have some or all of the following skills and experience:


Professional experience of 2-8 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch and excellent knowledge of English


Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.

Now Take the Next Step

If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.

What Do We Offer


An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a green mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture


Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Ethics & Business Integrity
Description:
Make your mark for patients

We are looking for a Data Analyst - Ethics & Business Integrity who is analytical, communicative, and self-motivated to join us in our Ethics & Business Integrity (E&BI) team, based in our headquarters office in Brussels, Belgium or in our office in Atlanta, United States.

About The Role

You will be working in a team that designs the compliance monitoring program, including data analysis, research, data management, and reporting, with a goal of enabling the E&BI Team to make informed decisions based on empirical evidence, promoting ethics and business integrity within the organization. Your focus will be on designing data analytics approaches to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of monitoring approaches.

Who You’ll Work With

You will collaborate with various E&BI teams, IT teams, and external partners/vendors to deliver comprehensive data insights and analytics supporting ethical practices and business integrity.

What You’ll Do


Identify opportunities for data-informed reporting and analytics within E&BI.
Assess relevant data sources availability across the organization.
Develop data analytics models to generate insights related to ethics and business integrity.
Deploy and evaluate data analytics solutions and communicate results effectively ….


Interested? For this role we’re looking for the following education, experience and skills


Excellent analytical skills for identifying trends and insights from data.
Experience with compliance monitoring approaches preferred.
Strong knowledge and interest in data (Data Visualization/BI Tools, Coding Languages & Tools).
Effective communication skills, including presentations and clear writing.
Ability to influence stakeholders to maximize the impact of ethics and integrity analytics.
Proven problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.


Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

About Us

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

Why work with us?

At UCB, we don’t just complete tasks, we create value. We aren’t afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equitable opportunities to do their best work. We ‘go beyond’ to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that’s on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on EMEA-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com . Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments; we will not be able to support you through this channel.

Title: Reporting & Data Analyst
Description:
Als Reporting & Data Analyst maak je deel uit van een dynamisch team dat zich focust op analyse en rapportering voor Indirecte Aankopen binnen Colruyt Group Technics. Jouw bijdrage speelt een belangrijke rol bij besluitvormingsprocessen en het bevorderen van de groei van het bedrijf. Een job met veel impact!




Een greep uit jouw takenpakket:

Als Reporting & Data Analyst binnen Colruyt Group Technics ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en rapporteren van gegevens die cruciaal zijn voor onze bedrijfsvoering. Hiervoor ontwikkel, onderhoud en optimaliseer je periodieke rapportages en dashboards met behulp van Power BI.
Je analyseert hierbij data om trends, patronen en inzichten te ontdekken, maar ook knelpunten en verbeterpunten te vinden. Vanuit jouw inzichten doe je voorstellen voor datagedreven verbeteringen en strategische initiatieven.
Je werkt samen met verschillende interne stakeholders om hun noden en rapportagebehoeften te begrijpen en te vervullen.
Je schrijft werkmethodes uit, stelt gedetailleerde opleidingsmappen op ifv. de opgestelde rapporteringen en geeft trainingen aan medewerkers om hen te ondersteunen bij het gebruik van rapportages en data-analysetools.
Je werkt nauw samen met jouw team om gegevensgestuurde oplossingen te ontwikkelen en te implementeren.
Je waakt over de datakwaliteit binnen de verschillende systemen aan de hand van rapporteringen en draagt op die manier actief bij aan de continue verbetering van dataverzamelings- en analyseprocessen.

Je werkt in Halle en kunt tot 2 dagen per week thuiswerken of in een van onze regionale kantoren (Mechelen, Haasrode, Zwijnaarde, …).




Profiel




Ervaring – Je hebt minstens een bachelordiploma in een relevante studierichting zoals Data Science, Statistiek, Wiskunde, … en ervaring met het werken in complexe spreadsheets in Excel. Basiskennis van SAP is een pluspunt.
Analytisch vermogen – Je bent analytisch en kunt complexe informatie vertalen naar begrijpelijke inzichten zonder de details uit het oog te verliezen.
Teamplayer – Je werkt in een multidisciplinair team, je haalt energie uit samenwerken om de beste resultaten te halen.
Initiatief – Je bent gedreven en pakt je werk zelf vast om op een efficiënte manier je doel te bereiken. Zie je dat iets beter kan? Dan ga je daar mee aan de slag.
Communicatie - Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe gegevens eenvoudig uit te leggen.
Talenkennis – Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en Frans en kunt informatie vlot overbrengen aan je collega’s en stakeholders.




Wij bieden




Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket, gecombineerd met extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, winstdeelname en een hospitalisatieverzekering.
Opleidingen en leertrajecten – Wij voorzien opleidingen die aansluiten bij je ervaring en behoeften. Je krijgt alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontplooien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak.
Eigen verantwoordelijkheden - We geven je de kans om je eigen verantwoordelijkheden op te nemen, maar ook om je eigen ideeën en initiatieven mee vorm te geven.
Werkzekerheid – Colruyt Group is een stabiel bedrijf in volle groei met ruim 32.000 medewerkers. Bij ons kan je dus rekenen op werkzekerheid én een mooie toekomst!
Plezant werken – Een hecht en dynamisch team staat te popelen om jou te leren kennen. Je staat er niet alleen voor, voor vragen kan je altijd bij hen terecht.




Je gaat aan de slag bij Colruyt Group Technics, onze interne technische dienst. We ontwerpen, (ver)bouwen en onderhouden alle winkels, distributiecentra, DATS 24-tankstations, voertuigen en installaties van Colruyt Group. Of je nu technieker, administratief medewerker of architect bent, je merkt meteen de impact van je werk.

Show more

Wij bieden


  • Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket, gecombineerd met extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, winstdeelname en een hospitalisatieverzekering.
  • Opleidingen en leertrajecten – Wij voorzien opleidingen die aansluiten bij je ervaring en behoeften. Je krijgt alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontplooien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak.
  • Eigen verantwoordelijkheden - We geven je de kans om je eigen verantwoordelijkheden op te nemen, maar ook om je eigen ideeën en initiatieven mee vorm te geven.
  • Werkzekerheid – Colruyt Group is een stabiel bedrijf in volle groei met ruim 32.000 medewerkers. Bij ons kan je dus rekenen op werkzekerheid én een mooie toekomst!
  • Plezant werken – Een hecht en dynamisch team staat te popelen om jou te leren kennen. Je staat er niet alleen voor, voor vragen kan je altijd bij hen terecht.


  • Je gaat aan de slag bij Colruyt Group Technics, onze interne technische dienst. We ontwerpen, (ver)bouwen en onderhouden alle winkels, distributiecentra, DATS 24-tankstations, voertuigen en installaties van Colruyt Group. Of je nu technieker, administratief medewerker of architect bent, je merkt meteen de impact van je werk.

Title: Internship Data Analytics
Description:
Smart and efficient – Bosch Home Comfort offers its customers throughout the world solutions for their room climate, domestic hot water and decentralized energy management requirements. For this Bosch Home Comfort applies highly efficient technologies which in many cases use renewable energies and make a significant contribution to implementing the energy transition.

Bosch Home Comfort, based in Wetzlar and Wernau/Stuttgart, manufactures in more than 120 engineering locations in in Europe, America and Asia and achieved sales of 5.5 billion euros in 2018. The product portfolio ranges from floor-standing and wall-hung gas and oil boilers and water heaters to solar thermal systems, heat pumps for heating and cooling and large-scale commercial and industrial systems such as industrial boilers, CHP and waste heat recovery systems for industrial processes.

Bosch Home Comfort Belgium, situated in Mechelen, is a pure sales country unit that operates under the brands Buderus and Bosch.

You will be working as a Data Analytics Intern in the Business Intelligence department at Bosch Home Comfort in Mechelen. Your main responsibility will be to further develop and maintain the 360-degree view of our customers, which will be used to steer the departments (Marketing, Sales, Sales Operations, etc). You will support in projects and process optimization. You will maintain and harmonize the data present in different applications. Furthermore, you will be responsible for several Sales reports (in Power BI and Excel) and may be asked to conduct several analyses.

You are currently a student (Data Analytics, Statistics, International Business Management, Marketing, Economical Studies, etc.) and you are interested in Data Analytics and Business Intelligence.

You have excellent analytical and problem solving skills. You are curious and have a positive mindset. You are well-organized, can work independently, efficiently and are self-motivated.

You have practical knowledge of MS Excel and Power BI. Fluency in English is mandatory. Good knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.

We are looking forward to receiving your application by e-mail in English (please mention the exact title of the position). Do not hesitate to contact us if you have any further questions.

If you are a student enrolled in a University/College (or if you are available for a voluntary internship outside a university curriculum) you will be granted an allowance of € 1035,30/month.


If you want to apply for a voluntary internship, you must be a citizen of the EU or have a work permit in Belgium.
In case that you need to do a mandatory internship, your University/College must be located in a member state of the EU.


Starting date: December 2024

Duration: 6 months

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

Title: Internal Controls Data Analyst
Description:
Make your mark for patients

To strengthen our Group Accounting, Tax and Treasury team, based at our HQ, in Brussels, Belgium, we are looking for a talented individual to fill the position of Internal Controls Data Analyst.

About The Role

The Global Internal Control function operates as an independent function but supports the operations/line management in building and maintaining efficient and effective internal control process/system. It also monitors compliance of finance processes, systems, and its operations in accordance with UCB policies and procedures in coordination with audit functions. We are expanding our scope to non-financial reporting (namely Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) / Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD)).


Internal Controls Data Analyst will play a critical role in ensuring the integrity, efficiency, and compliance of our financial processes as well as non-financial reporting (ESG/CSRD).
Responsible and accountable for connection of data sources, analysis and answering business questions via consistent and auditable methods.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance our control environment and influence system setups.
Reports to Head of Internal Controls


What You’ll Do


Extract and interpret financial and non-financial data to uncover trends and areas for improvement.
Translate complex data into actionable insights for informed decision-making.
Proactively engage stakeholders to understand business needs and develop meaningful reports.
Create dashboards to provide valuable information for management and audit purposes.
Assess existing controls and processes, identifying gaps and inefficiencies.
Recommend enhancements based on data findings to optimize procedures.


Interested? For this position you’ll need the following education, experience and skills:


Bachelor's degree required; minimum 5 years of finance process experience in a global organization, preferably in pharma/biopharma.
Minimum 3-4 years of relevant experience in data analytics; experience in ESG reporting is advantageous.
Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R) and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, QlikSense).
Knowledge of finance, accounting, and auditing principles; familiarity with industry internal control standards such as COSO.
Understanding of financial processes (S2P, O2C, R2R, Master Data, Tax) and their risks & controls, including interfaces with other functional areas.
Strong analytical skills, proactive mindset, excellent stakeholder management, negotiation skills, and proven leadership ability within a global organization.


Why you should apply

Do you want to contribute in bringing real value to patients living with severe diseases while driving innovation forward?

Join UCB’s dynamic, inspiring and innovative environment and team. You will be recognized for impactful performance via a competitive compensation and benefits package and you will enjoy ample personal development opportunities.

Tell us what makes you the perfect match to our team and join one of the most dynamic & forward looking IT organizations in the world.

Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

About Us

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

Why work with us?

At UCB, we don’t just complete tasks, we create value. We aren’t afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equitable opportunities to do their best work. We ‘go beyond’ to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that’s on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on on EMEA-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com . Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments; we will not be able to support you through this channel.

Title: Data Analyst HR
Description:
ACENSI BELGIUM is looking for his client an HR Data Analyst (F/M/X)







How can you make a difference?

As a Data Analyst, you are responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting HR data to generate valuable insights.







What is your role ?

As an HR Data Analyst, your main responsibilities include the following:

You act as an HR data expert for other teams within the organization.
In this capacity, you will represent HR in the various data governance bodies
You ensure the accuracy and quality of the data.
You identify opportunities for process and application improvements through data analysis.
You guarantee a logical structuring of data based on processes and reporting needs.







Ready for this new challenge?

You also possess the following skills:

You have an analytical and critical mindset and are able to take responsibility!
You are eager to learn and have a strong team spirit.
You work autonomously to achieve the desired results while respecting deadlines.
You have good communication skills and can present complex data in an understandable way.
You are able to lead a meeting in both national languages (French and Dutch).
Knowledge of SAP HR and/or SuccessFactors is an asset.
You have a good knowledge of MS Office 365 tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams, etc.).







Where will you work?

You will work in the HR Program Office.

The team consists of around twenty colleagues with various roles (business analyst, data analyst, process analyst, program manager, and reporting analyst), and the workplace is located in Brussels, just a few steps from Brussels-Midi station.

Title: Freelance Data Analyst - Brussels
Description:
Dark Light is a staffing agency specialized in Data & BI. For a client in Brussels we are looking for a Junior Data Analyst with a first experience in data analysis.

Tasks


Cleaning, reprocessing, and analyzing large datasets to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Addressing data gaps, managing data governance principles, and ensuring accurate data migration across tools.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and gather data requirements.
Using data insights to support decision-making processes.
Presenting findings through reports, presentations, and storytelling to various stakeholders.
Developing data visualizations using tools like Tableau and Power BI.


Requirements


A proactive attitude with the ability to work autonomously under pressure.
Strong stakeholder management and communication skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (intermediate to advanced).
Ability to clean, manipulate, and analyze large datasets.
Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
Experience working within procurement or with supplier-related data is advantageous.


Benefits


LT-contract
Location: Brussels
Flexible remote policy: 1d on-site

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

En tant que Marketing Data Analyst vous avez l’opportunité de repousser les limites du marketing. Vous plongez quotidiennement dans l’analyse de données et le reporting. Vous analysez notamment les tendances du marché et le comportement des clients afin de formuler des propositions novatrices pour des campagnes marketing qui marquent. Vos rapports sont essentiels pour la direction afin de pendre des décisions bien calibrées et pour marquer la stratégie marketing d’un acteur de premier plan dans notre industrie. Grâce à vous, tous les collaborateurs disposent des données dont ils ont besoin.

Ces Tâches Forment Votre Quotidien


Réaliser des analyses de marché très poussées qui permettent de prendre les bonnes décisions stratégiques. Vous traduisez des ensembles de données complexes dans des recommandations pratiques pour améliorer la notoriété de notre marque et stimuler nos ventes.
Création de rapports visuels accrocheurs dans Power BI à propos des machines vendues, les parts de marché, la prise de commande, le modèle et la business unit.
Analyse et révision annuelle du degré de couverture de nos commerciaux afin de déterminer quelles régions sont les mieux desservies. Mise à jour de ces données dans nos systèmes ERP et CRM.
Mise à jour de l’ensemble des dasboards sales/marketing dans notre CRM (Salesforce) et créez des nouveaux tableaux de bord si nécessaire.
Réalisation mensuelle de dashboards clairs concernant l’ensemble de nos actions de marketing digitales et vous formulez des recommandations pour optimiser ces campagnes.
Vous allez plus loin que les analyses marketing conventionnelles car vous créez des nouvelles ‘expériences client’. Ensuite, vous implémentez vos créations par le biais de Marketing Cloud Salesforce.
En tant que coordinateur du programme ‘Marketing & Sales Excellence’ vous travaillez avec les départements concernés afin d’atteindre les objectifs et assurer le suivi des actions.
Organisation et préparation des enquêtes de satisfaction client. Analyse des résultats et facilitation des initiatives d’amélioration de la satisfaction client.


Profiel kandidaat

Vous voulez un job dynamique dans une culture d’entreprise informelle. Vous êtes extrêmement analytique et bon communicateur. Votre œil aiguisé du détail et votre capacité de détecter des modèles/tendances dans un ensemble complexe de données, vous permettent d’implémenter vos stratégies marketing out-of-the box.

Vos Compétences


Diplôme de bachelor ou master en marketing ou une filière connexe.
Niveau de compétence avancé en Excel (Power Querry/vba), en Power BI (DAX) et en rapportage graphique/visuel.
De l’expérience avec la conduite d’analyses de marché et de la concurrence.
Très grande capacité analytique et de l’expérience avec des outils d’analyse de données.
D’excellentes capacités de communication et de présentation.
Bon bilingue néerlandais/français (écrit et parlé) et une très bonne maîtrise de l’anglais.
Minimum 3 ans d’expérience dans une fonction similaire.
De l’expérience avec Marketing Cloud et Salesforce Sales Cloud (data model) est un atout).
Orienté résultats : atteindre des résultats mesurables.
Suivre les dernières tendances dans le domaine du marketing, surtout l’analyse et le rapportage.
Réflexion out-of-the box et proposition de solutions iinnovantes.
Sens du détail et rigueur.
Orienté client et solutions.
Flexibilité.
Utilisation fluide des outils Office 365.


Geboden wordt


Un contrat à durée déterminée avec un salaire et des avantages extralégaux comme des chèques-repas, assurances (groupe, invalidité, hospitalisation), voiture,laptop, smartphone et un Flex Income Plan.
Un job chez le concessionnaire exclusif de machines Caterpillar.
Des jours de télétravail.
Bon équilibre entre vie privée et professionnelle = Happiness @ Work.
Une bonne ambiance de travail et des collègues sur lesquels on peut compter.
Formations.
Contacts internationaux au sein de Caterpillar et du Monnoyeur Group.


Meer informatie

Envie d'en savoir plus sur notre organisation? Allez faire un tour sur notre page entreprise (cliquez sur le logo au-dessus de l'offre d'emploi).

Postuler?

Postulez en direct en cliquant sur le bouton ci-dessus.

Questions? Infos?

Contactez notre recruteur Ilias.
Show more

Geboden wordt

  • Un contrat à durée déterminée avec un salaire et des avantages extralégaux comme des chèques-repas, assurances (groupe, invalidité, hospitalisation), voiture,laptop, smartphone et un Flex Income Plan.

  • Des jours de télétravail.
  • Bon équilibre entre vie privée et professionnelle = Happiness @ Work.

  • Formations.

Title: Business Intelligence Support
Description:
Working Location: Brussels, Belgium
Language: High proficiency level in English language


Experience And Education

Essential Qualifications/Experience:


Analytical mindset – working with data
Pragmatic in finding solutions to make progress
Data visualisation:


ü Communicative – convincing others, leading (smaller) change initiatives, being able to bring complex matter in a way that is adjusted to the audience

ü Structured – bringing structure to complex and ambiguous information

ü Project WoW/Organized – able to keep oversight and priorities straight when working on several initiatives at the same time

ü Self-sufficient/independent – being able to look for information when needed, being able to work independently


PM:


ü Data viz tools Oracle BI and Power BI

ü Advanced Excel skills

ü PowerPoint

ü Data science is an asset

ü Automation is an asset

Duties/Role

ü HR experience could be an asset, not required


Support continuous listening roll-out and operations
Support ad hoc survey activities (incl further development of leavers feedback survey)
Support data/reporting governance roll-out and operations (e.g. DQ monitoring, supporting stewards/power users, SLA discussion)
Support org taxonomy review and operations
Support reporting and data visualization projects/initiatives (e.g. OBIA, OTBI, OBIEE, reporting for LFS, RPMO)
Support in ad hoc reporting requests (e.g. basic reporting questions core HR/TA/PM/etc, sick leave analysis, annual report)
Support monthly reporting cycle
Support improvement initiatives
Show more
HTML:
• Working Location: Brussels, Belgium

Experience And Education

 Essential Qualifications/Experience:

  • Support ad hoc survey activities (incl further development of leavers feedback survey)
  • Support data/reporting governance roll-out and operations (e.g. DQ monitoring, supporting stewards/power users, SLA discussion)
