Title: Data & Analytics (Power BI)
Description:
Job Description

As the Data & Analytics team member, you will drive the development of global consolidation and corporate performance management processes using Azure, MS-SQL, Tagetik, MDM, and Power BI Fabric technologies.

You also will collaborate closely with business stakeholders, bridging requirements to data modeling.

You will engage with Data Warehouse team throughout specifications, development, validation, and post-development support phases; design and create new datasets and reports in Power BI Online and Excel.

You will finally provide coaching and training to business users across various domains (Sales, Finance, HR, etc.) on Power BI Desktop and internal applications, and support end users in adopting new systems and consolidation workflows.

Responsibilities & Duties

As the Data & Analytics employee, your responsibilities will turn across different points:

Projects:


You act as primary Power BI stakeholder for system development and enhancements
And collaborate with BI Manager and Business Owner(s) on corporate reporting functionalities
You also conduct technical and integration tests for new applications and programs.


System and Interfaces Support:


You have to manage Power BI Online and MDM for all users (installation, configuration)
Install and validate system updates
And also, document and update system procedures.


Application Support:


You enhance and maintain existing reports and processes
And analyze and implement new functionalities or reports.


Users Support:


You offer guidance, support, and coaching to users
Develop training documentation and conduct user training
And finally assist business owners in validating data and reports.


Your Profile


Bachelor’s Degree preferred, or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience
3+ years of MS-SQL and Power BI (or Equivalent Reporting) experience
Strong grasp of MS-SQL database management (Management Studio, Visual Studio)
Demonstrated experience in hands-on training for application/report users
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure and Data Warehouses environments
Familiarity with SAP (ECC, HCM, and BW)
Proficiency in understanding programming languages: SQL, DAX, and Python
Fluent in English
Limited International travel required
You are a person well organized, reliable, who likes to support the business and building the bridges.


Preferred Experience:


Experience with TimeXtender or equivalent data integration applications
Knowledge of Azure Data Factory and Microsoft Fabric
Knowledge of Standard API Integration workflows
Experience supporting or implementing a Master Data Management system, including data governance, business glossary, and metadata management tools.


The Data & Analytics Team:

The Data & Analytics team has the mission to empower our organization through data driven insights and analytics. In order to do this the team is in the process of building a robust and scalable modern data platform. Besides the current role, the team is composed of BI analysts, data engineers, system architects and business analysts for data governance. Geographically the team is based in the US and Belgium, its responsibilities extend to all parts of the Carmeuse Group globally. Working within our team you will be responsible to further develop and manage our corporate performance management tool used for financial consolidation, budgeting and planning.

You Future Manager

Brian Culp, is the manager and has worked at Carmeuse since July 2020. He brings over a decade of experience in data management and reporting, along with 6+ years of expertise in Power BI. His deep understanding of commercial and industrial operations underscores the importance of consistent and accurate data consolidation. Brian’s leadership style is built on trust, integrity, and support. He is committed to creating a supportive and open atmosphere where individual contributions are valued, and professional growth is a priority. He actively encourages honest input from his team, fostering a collaborative environment that enhances efficiency and performance and ensures reliable and practical solutions for their internal customers.

The Recruitment Process:

As the recruitment process, what do you think of these steps:


Olivia Braszko, our Talent Acquisition Lead will analyze your Résumé and cover letter
A first "Teams" interview will be scheduled with Olivia. You will take 2 personality questionnaires. She will want to know more about you, as a person and as a professional. She will assess your motivations and answer to your questions
You will have a second interview with Brian Culp (our BI Manager) and Aurelie Mordant (our HRBP)
The last interview will take place with John Verkaik (our Group Data Analytics Director).


Why Carmeuse?

We truly believe that where you work matters and, as a family business, we know what makes our employees happy!


Permanent
Flexible working hours
Home working policy
Competitive salary package and benefits
A lot of growing possibilities
A strong HR and training policy to develop your skills
Work life balance.


About Us

READY TO JOIN A ROCK-SOLID FAMILY?

Carmeuse started out as a small family-run business in Belgium.

Today it’s a leading global producer of lime, high calcium limestone and dolomitic stone. Its products are essential to energy producers, environmental services, construction and manufacturing.

With over 90 production facilities spread across almost every continent, and over 4,500 employees working at Carmeuse every day, the company’s most treasured resources are its people.

Carmeuse is dedicated to maintaining a workplace that fosters equal opportunity and creates a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation or gender identity. If you require particular assistance with any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, you can submit your request by sending an email to hrsupport@carmeuse.com. This option is reserved for people requiring adaptation due to a disability. The information received will be processed by Carmeuse and then directed to a local recruiter who will provide assistance to ensure the proper consideration of the application or hiring process.

Title: Strategic Insights Analyst
Description:
ECO3 is a leading global supplier of prepress systems to the printing industry. Commercial, newspaper and packaging printers rely on us for the most extensive range of integrated solutions, from printing plates and computer-to-plate systems over workflow and print management software to pressroom chemicals. Our solutions are designed to deliver higher productivity, lower costs and greener outcomes at every stage of the print process.




We are a company with a positive mindset and a ‘can do’ attitude, continuously striving for excellence. ECO3 is headquartered in Belgium with production centers in Germany, Brazil and China. We are commercially active worldwide through sales organizations and dealers in more than 30 countries.




You print. We care.




We are seeking a Strategic Insights Analyst, a high-potential professional who will work closely with senior management and the leadership team. This role is designed for someone eager to contribute to strategic initiatives that drive growth and operational excellence within the organization.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with senior managers and the management team on key strategic projects, focusing on transformation and restructuring efforts to enhance operational effectiveness and long-term value.
Conduct thorough analyses to support decision-making processes, identifying opportunities for improvement and innovation in business operations.
Assist in project management activities, ensuring that timelines, budgets, and objectives are met through effective coordination and collaboration with cross-functional teams.
Participate in brainstorming sessions and workshops, contributing fresh ideas and insights that align with the company’s growth strategies.
Support the implementation of change management initiatives, helping teams adapt to new processes and systems introduced during transformation projects.
Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations for senior leadership, summarizing findings, recommendations, and project updates.
Foster a collaborative team environment, building strong relationships across departments and promoting a culture of continuous improvement.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in transformation and restructuring, bringing innovative ideas to the team.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Engineering, or a related field.
2+ years of professional experience in consulting or industry, with a focus on operations, restructuring, or strategic initiatives.
Demonstrated experience in project management and teamwork, with a track record of successful collaboration in dynamic environments.
Strong analytical skills with a results-oriented mindset and the ability to approach complex problems logically.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of effectively conveying ideas and insights to diverse audiences.
A well-developed sense of responsibility and a strong commitment to achieving high-quality outcomes.
A passion for driving growth and delivering exceptional change within organizations.
An entrepreneurial spirit, characterized by initiative, creativity, and a proactive approach to identifying opportunities.




Key Competencies:

Strategic thinking and the ability to analyze and synthesize complex information.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills, with a focus on building productive relationships.
Excellent organizational skills, capable of managing multiple projects and priorities effectively.
High levels of accountability, with a commitment to delivering results and making a positive impact.




Why Join Us? As a Strategic Insights Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work closely with senior leaders on high-impact projects that shape the future of our organization. This role offers a unique chance to develop your career in a supportive environment where your contributions will be valued and recognized. If you are passionate about driving change and looking to make a difference, we encourage you to apply.

Show more

Title: Data Mining Analyst
Description:
Description




En tant que Data Mining Analyst, vous fournissez, au management, des solutions basées sur des données destinées à faciliter la prise de décision (via le machine learning et le data mining).




Vous transformez, enrichissez et archivez des données business opérationnelles.




Vous participez à la définition des objectifs business du data mining. Vous pouvez ainsi guider les Information/Business Analysts dans leur traduction des besoins business.




Vous êtes également en charge de l'implémentation d'un modèle de data mining : vous transformez les données et faites de l'exploration de données.




Vous développez des modèles et assurez leur implémentation, leur maintenance, leur évaluation et leur optimisation.




Enfin, vous êtes impliqué dans des projets spécifiques (ex. : environnement de travail cloud) ou dans l'analyse de la fraude, en collaboration avec le service Concurrence loyale.




Profil




Titulaire d’un diplôme de master, vous disposez de plusieurs années d'expérience dans une fonction similaire.
Vous avez une bonne connaissance des techniques de machine learning et d'IA (cf. analyse de données). Vous possédez également un bon bagage en matière de statistiques, avec une connaissance active des modèles analytiques.
Vous êtes passionné par SQL et les bases de données. Vous maîtrisez Python.
Votre connaissance de KNIME ou d'applications similaires constitue un plus.
Vous avez le sens de la communication et êtes capable de communiquer aisément avec différents interlocuteurs.
Vous avez un esprit analytique et privilégiez une approche structurée.
Vous pouvez travailler efficacement de manière autonome, mais appréciez également le travail en équipe.
Enfin, vous possédez une connaissance passive du néerlandais.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Onderneming

Deze Belgische onderneming gelegen te Machelen staat gekend om haar ruimtelijke economische projecten met betrekking tot duurzaamheid. Omwille van hun sterke dynamische groei zijn ze momenteel op zoek naar een Data Analyst om hun huidig hecht IT-Team te versterken.

Takenpakket

Je zal verantwoordelijk zijn de data analyse van diverse interne projecten ter optimalisatie van de bedrijfsprocessen. Deze presenteer je aan de betrokken leidinggevenden door middel van informatieve dashboards en waardevolle gegevens. Je beheert het volledige gegevensproces, van het vastleggen en integreren van gegevens uit diverse bronnen tot het verrijken en koppelen van gegevens in het datawarehouse. Je publiceert dashboards met PowerBI en onderhoudt contact met interne gebruikers om hun behoeften en feedback te begrijpen.

Profiel


Je hebt een Bachelor of Master diploma in IT
Je hebt ervaring binnen PowerBI
Je bent sterk analytisch en communicatief ingesteld
Je bent innovatief en leergierig
Schoolverlaters welkom!



Aanbod


Elektrische bedrijfswagen met laadkaart
Nettovergoedingen
Maaltijd- en ecocheques
Groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering
CAO90 bonus
Gsm met abonnement
Flexible werkuren
Thuiswerk
32 vakantiedagen

Title: Associate Specialist, Analytics and Business Insights (Rosetta)-R-230613
Description:
Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Title And Summary

Associate Specialist, Analytics and Business Insights (Rosetta)

Overview

The Associate specialist will be in charge of analytic and operational support of the team leader and other team members in their work. Further the candidate will own the data research and analysis in the selected areas.

The candidate will be part of the team at the heart of Mastercard Europe’s data. Analytics and Business Insights team seeks to empower everyone in Europe to use data to drive outstanding results. Main stakeholders of the team are sales and business development functions as well as European Management.

The position will enable the candidate to develop deep understanding of Mastercard’s data, data analysis and visualization, business insight creation as well as how analytics and business insights are leveraged in different areas of Mastercard’s business. As part of the team you will have exposure to Mastercard’s global network of data and analytics teams and individuals.

Role

In This Position, You Will


Perform data research and analysis at both operational and strategic levels as well as insight generation
Preparation of business insight snippets and presentations
Conduct data testing and data reconciliation
Data tools and capabilities research and study
Educate various stakeholders on data tools and capabilities
Support design, development and deployment of new data capabilities
Support and own maintenance, update and enhancement of existing data capabilities (dashboards, ETL flows, sematic models, etc)
Conduct data ETL (extract, transform, load) for various projects
Conduct operational support of Analytics and Business Insights team (e.g. intranet communications, confluence and mailbox handling, access management, stakeholders communications management, etc)
Prepare data capabilities documentation
Prepare presentations and other communications



All About You

The ideal candidate for this position should have the below profile and key requirements:


MA/MSc in math, physics, engineering, finance, economy, or computer science
Fluency in math and passion for numbers (knowledge of business statistics is a plus)
Agile and proactive thinker with curiosity to learn and eagerness to crack complex topics
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to understand, create and explain complex concepts
Attention to details and diligence
Responsible and reliable
Ability to exercise ownership over assigned tasks (perception of the tasks in a broader context, ability to offer new approaches, respect of deadlines, ability to anticipate and address risks)
Good at defining problems and opportunities and finding solutions
Out of box thinking, ability and eagerness to look for non-trivial solutions
Good communication skills in all situations
Ability to work with both high level concepts and applied data points
Ability to work independently and handling different projects at the same time, stress resistant
Good team player
Experience with any of the following tools is a plus: Power BI, Alteryx, SSIS, SQL, Python
Software development experience is a plus (either professionally or as a hobby)
Strong PC User (Excel (with modelling), PowerPoint, etc)
Fluency in English



Corporate Security Responsibility

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:


Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.



R-230613
Show more
HTML:
Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Title And Summary

Associate Specialist, Analytics and Business Insights (Rosetta)

Overview

The Associate specialist will be in charge of analytic and operational support of the team leader and other team members in their work. Further the candidate will own the data research and analysis in the selected areas.

The candidate will be part of the team at the heart of Mastercard Europe’s data. Analytics and Business Insights team seeks to empower everyone in Europe to use data to drive outstanding results. Main stakeholders of the team are sales and business development functions as well as European Management.

The position will enable the candidate to develop deep understanding of Mastercard’s data, data analysis and visualization, business insight creation as well as how analytics and business insights are leveraged in different areas of Mastercard’s business. As part of the team you will have exposure to Mastercard’s global network of data and analytics teams and individuals.

Role

In This Position, You Will

  • Perform data research and analysis at both operational and strategic levels as well as insight generation
  • Preparation of business insight snippets and presentations
  • Conduct data testing and data reconciliation
  • Data tools and capabilities research and study
  • Educate various stakeholders on data tools and capabilities
  • Support design, development and deployment of new data capabilities
  • Support and own maintenance, update and enhancement of existing data capabilities (dashboards, ETL flows, sematic models, etc)
  • Conduct data ETL (extract, transform, load) for various projects
  • Conduct operational support of Analytics and Business Insights team (e.g. intranet communications, confluence and mailbox handling, access management, stakeholders communications management, etc)
  • Prepare data capabilities documentation
  • Prepare presentations and other communications


All About You

The ideal candidate for this position should have the below profile and key requirements:

  • MA/MSc in math, physics, engineering, finance, economy, or computer science
  • Fluency in math and passion for numbers (knowledge of business statistics is a plus)
  • Agile and proactive thinker with curiosity to learn and eagerness to crack complex topics
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to understand, create and explain complex concepts
  • Attention to details and diligence
  • Responsible and reliable
  • Ability to exercise ownership over assigned tasks (perception of the tasks in a broader context, ability to offer new approaches, respect of deadlines, ability to anticipate and address risks)
  • Good at defining problems and opportunities and finding solutions
  • Out of box thinking, ability and eagerness to look for non-trivial solutions
  • Good communication skills in all situations
  • Ability to work with both high level concepts and applied data points
  • Ability to work independently and handling different projects at the same time, stress resistant
  • Good team player
  • Experience with any of the following tools is a plus: Power BI, Alteryx, SSIS, SQL, Python
  • Software development experience is a plus (either professionally or as a hobby)
  • Strong PC User (Excel (with modelling), PowerPoint, etc)
  • Fluency in English


Corporate Security Responsibility

 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:

  • Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
  • Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
  • Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
  • Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Description du poste :

CONTEXT:

L’Occitane Group Travel Retail team is looking for an Intern, based in Geneva (Switzerland). Reporting to RGM (Revenue Growth Management) Global Travel Retail Director, your mission will be to drive data-centric decisions for Pricing, Promotion and Assortment within the Travel Retail environment (airports, airlines, cruises and ferries).

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collaborate in the gathering, refining and structuring of data sourced from diverse channels
Design and implement new dashboards tailored to meet the evolving requirements of the Management team, focusing on aspects such as sell-out and sell-in performance
Support brands including L’Occitane, Sol de Janeiro, ELEMIS, Erborian, and Melvita in formulating annual pricing strategies
Take charge of regular monitoring and analysis of competitor pricing dynamics
Ensure the precision and reliability of collected data through rigorous quality control measures
Leverage data-driven insights to deliver actionable analyses aimed at enhancing both sales performance and profit margins

HOW YOU CAN FIT:

Student with Bachelor ou Masters' Degree within University or Business School (an internship agreement provided by your school is mandatory)
A first professional experience in Data Analytics is a plus
Proficiency in Excel
Fluent in English and French
Proactiveness and working autonomously, with excellent organization and project management skills
Entrepreneurial, solution oriented, with ability to adapt
Strong team spirit, good coordination skills
At ease in a fast-paced and multi task environment, working with short-term deadline

 

STARTING DATE: January 2025 for 6 months (full-time position)LOCATION: Geneva (Plan-les-Ouates), Switzerland

If you are selected, we will have the pleasure to meet you during an online recruitment day

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Sigma Suisse recherche pour son client, une organisation économique privée, un(e) Data Analyst / BI Analyst à Genève, en Suisse. La position est ouverte uniquement aux résidents Suisses (Vaud/Genève).




Descriptif du poste :




Etablir des rapports de gestion ainsi que sur l'expression des besoins métiers.
Produire des restitutions de données en utilisant des outils comme SAP BO ou Crystal Reports, ainsi que d'autres solutions potentielles.
Décrire et améliorer les processus liés à la qualité.
Poste axé sur la partie CRM & BI avec expertise en visualisation de données.
Former et assister les utilisateurs métiers, en créant des formations engageantes, support L1 / L2.
Maintenir et ajuster les configurations du système de gestion interne pour son bon fonctionnement.
Être autonome dans l’extraction de données, leur mise en forme et la création de rapports pour la prise de décision.
Poste orienté Data et Business Analysis, pas développement requis.
Identifier et résoudre les problèmes techniques liés au système en proposant des solutions innovantes.




Profil recherché :




Formation universitaire en informatique ou ingénierie.
Expérience confirmée en Business Intelligence et en conseil/formation.
Maîtrise du langage SQL.
Expérience en migration (ERP ou CRM)

Title: Data Analyst (50-100%, all genders)
Description:
Are you passionate about data? Fascinated by insights generated from data that deliver real impact? Then join the Operations Planning & Steering team and apply your data skills to real business challenges to shape SWISS’ journey towards a truly data-driven company!

Starting date: January 01, 2025 or upon agreement

You may apply in English or German.

Tasks

As a Data Analyst you will shift the boundaries of SWISS’ data capabilities and take a pivotal role in advising SWISS’ senior management. Join us and bring data-driven decision-making to the next level!


Provide valuable data-driven insights supporting decision-making within SWISS’ Operations & Steering team and beyond
Create data visualizations, reporting and interactive dashboards, prepare business cases and scenario calculations
Create insightful analysis to help quantifying key drivers to optimize SWISS’ operational performance
Continuously develop and enhance operational data landscape to improve data quality & support automation
Foster data democratization and self-service capabilities across the company
Recommend and implement the best practices for data & advanced analytics (esp. predictive analytics)
Work closely with Operations Planning & Steering departments and effectively communicate data insights to appropriate stakeholders.


Benefits


Company health management
Remote working (e.g. from home)
Flexible workhours and part-time working models
Attractive company pension scheme
Diversity programmes
Paid maternity and paternity leave
27 days of annual vacation
Subsidized parking or public transport
Flight benefits


Requirements


A degree in analytical subjects (e.g., data science, engineering, economics, statistics, mathematics, or related fields)
Experience in data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Excellent SQL coding skills and command of at least one programming language (R or Python preferred)
Strong analytical capabilities, incl. data manipulation, analysis & interpretation skills
Advanced knowledge of MS Office, esp. Excel & PPT
Experience in data science and/or data engineering is a significant advantage
Excellent oral and written presentation skills; capable of writing and illustrating analyses and presentations
Ability to interact professionally across all organizational levels
Team player with strong communication and social skills


For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Company

It’s the little differences that make working at SWISS so appealing. The fact, for example, that we treat every detail with care, see quality in terms of hospitality and view nationality through an international lens. In a similar way, we see variety as richness, a job as an experience and SWISS as a world of inspiration. You, too, will be stimulated in our special working environment – one in which, wherever you are, you’ll always feel: Truly SWISS .... where people matter.

Contact

Diana Munzinger

recruiting.services@swiss.com


Show more

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Pour notre division Recherche & Développement, nous recherchons un Business/Data Analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera d’analyser des données de la division afin de permettre le pilotage des activités au travers d’indicateurs.

Responsabilités


Garantir la maîtrise de la structure des données (contenant et contenu)
Animer le réseau Gouvernance des Données de la division et promouvoir la démarche
Définir les règles d'utilisation, de codification et de maintenance de la structure des données de base
Rédiger et communiquer les règles définies
Piloter et planifier des actions de nettoyage et/ou de maintenance en collaboration avec le réseau Gouvernance des Données
Assurer et consolider une surveillance de l'application des règles au travers d'indicateurs
Assurer la cohérence de processus avec les autres divisions et l'Informatique


Profil


Formation universitaire ou Ingénieur EPF
Expérience confirmée dans la gestion de données (ERP, PLM, Data Mining)
Maitrise des outils Office et de SAP, Windchill, Tableau constitue un atout
Expérience confirmée dans les méthodes agiles (rôle de Product Owner)
Personne dynamique, autonome, rigoureuse, ouverte d'esprit, apte à travailler en équipe et ayant le sens de la communication et du leadership


Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d'excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificat et diplômes).

Title: Data Analyst – Bio-Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to support our bio-pharmaceutical manufacturing operations. The ideal candidate will be responsible for assembling and managing data from multiple systems, contributing to cutting-edge analytics and ensuring the accuracy of data for key projects.




Responsibilities include:

Assemble and manage data for advanced analytics in bio-pharma manufacturing.
Ensure smooth data flow by transferring process data to the Global Data Mart (GDM
Collaborate with MSAT to assess process data and enhance decision-making.
Assist in preparing validation reports and Product Quality Reviews (PQRs).
Identify and resolve data discrepancies, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.




Requirements:

Identify and resolve data discrepancies, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Experience in data analysis within a manufacturing or bio-pharmaceutical environment is highly desirable.
Proficiency with data management tools and systems such as Excel, SQL, or other relevant data analysis software.
Experience with dashboard development and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.




To find out more, please contact Noah Coombes (noah.coombes@lifescirecruitment.com)

At Life Sciences Recruitment Ltd (LSR), we are a Global Life Science recruitment firm that specialises in partnering with start-ups, fast-growing biotech and pharmaceutical organisations.

Founded in 2021, we recognised the need for a company with the insights, knowledge and credibility of a search firm but offering a contingent service.

As one of the most competitive and fast-paced industries globally, succeeding and growing in the life sciences business requires a combination of creativity, technical expertise, and business savvy. At LSR, to find the best talent for your organisation, our dynamic recruitment consultants tap into our unparalleled network of contacts and apply a quality-based approach to a contingent search model tailored to your needs. We provide the most sought after candidates to fit your requirements ranging from temporary placement to Fortune 500 companies!

LSR is a privately owned and independent recruitment company focused on the Life Sciences industry. We are a subsidiary of Morgan Prestwich (MP), Europe's leading boutique Life Sciences executive search and advisory firm.

Title: Junior Financial Data Analyst - Graduate (Hybrid, m/f/x/d)
Description:
We are looking for graduates with strong interpersonal skills, who are eager to learn, broaden their knowledge and expertise and want to make a difference. You have a Bachelor, Master, or PhD degree with less than 3 years of professional experience – we invite you to apply to our Graduate Programme which officially starts on 1 September 2025.

The programme offers you the chance to join the dynamic, fast-moving world of a leading risk knowledge organisation. Over an 18-month period, you will receive on- and off-the-job training, including a job rotation that gives you the opportunity to work across different lines of business and departments.

About The Team

The Market Risk Management (MRM) team within the Solvency & Financial Risk Management department will be your homebase during the programme and you will also have the opportunity to complete one or two rotations of 16-20 weeks total (possible destinations could, e.g., be Treasury / AM / other areas of the Solvency & Financial Risk Management department such as credit risk management, risk modelling, financial model validation). The market risk management team has presence in Zurich, London, New York City / Armonk, and Bangalore. The role will work across all three product areas within MRM, i.e., Credit & Equities; Treasury & Rates; and (Re)Insurance Transactions.

About The Role

The cross-functional role will involve deriving risk analytics and developing/maintaining various applications (dashboards, own R packages, APIs) for financial risk managers. The position holder will support the product areas in their regular responsibilities and deliverables and engage in a significant amount of project-based work.

Here Are Some Areas You Might Focus On


Scenario impact on risk measures and balance sheet metrics using open-source or commercial frameworks
Supporting the management reporting process through execution and enhancement of current reports
Data integration across various of the Group's internal and external data sources
Design and development of RShiny server dashboards
Analysis of embedded financial market risks within reinsurance transactions using the in-house libraries


Essentials

About You


Master's degree in quantitative subject (e.g., Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Finance)
Solid coding skills in at least one major data language (R and/or Python)
(A lot of) intellectual curiosity, drive and interest in financial and quantitative topics
Fully proficient in English


Nice To Have


Prior professional experience with financial risk management (quantitative / market / credit etc), treasury or within asset management within the banking or (re)insurance sector


Opportunities For Further Learning And Growth


MS SQL Server databases and Analysis Services and/or with the DAX query language
REST APIs and querying them in R / Python
Version control / Git
Deep R proficiency incl package development, environment management, code optimization, object-oriented programming (R6 classes), RShiny dashboards, Quarto, code parallelization etc
Apache Spark / PySpark


Please note that the application process will be open until beginning of November. The active selection and interview process will start afterwards, and you may not hear from us in the meantime. This does not mean you application is ignored. Please keep this in mind in case you do not hear from us within upcoming weeks. We will keep you informed of any updates or changes to the schedule. Thank you for your understanding.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Keywords

Reference Code: 131093

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Keywords

Reference Code: 131093

Title: Data Analyst (Processes) 100%
Description:
To strengthen our IT and product teams, we are looking for a Data Analyst (Processes) to lead initiatives focused on process improvements and process mining. The ideal candidate should have strong skills in data analysis, ideally previous experience in process mining, and general business process management knowledge. This is a full-time, permanent position based in our office in Basel.

Tasks & Responsibilities

As the Data Analyst (Processes), you will be responsible for:


Collaborating with business stakeholders to distil and analyze business requirements.
Performing process analysis using data from log files and databases (process mining).
Documenting processes, including creating process models using standard notations (such as BPMN, can be easily learned on-the-job).
Managing and coordinating business process change projects.


Additionally, you will:


Support business stakeholders (editorial, production, finance) in process optimization discussions.
Provide consultancy to editorial, production, and other departments on process-related matters.
Act as a key collaborator with the development teams that are working on workflow-related software.
Advocate for best practices in process management and continuous improvement.


Requirements


Education and Work Experience: A university degree (Master’s preferred) in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field. Alternatively, a business degree with significant relevant work experience. 3-5 years of experience as a business analyst, data analyst, or similar role (or equivalent experience in workflow-related enterprise applications).
Process Mining & Data Analysis: Strong ability to gather, analyze, and interpret data (from logs, databases, or data sets) to identify patterns and trends and support data-driven process improvements. SQL and data analysis skills are required for this role: you have experience in a general-purpose programming language suitable for data analysis (Python, R), or alternatively previous experience with process mining tools.
Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking: Strong aptitude for identifying process inefficiencies, diagnosing root causes, and developing practical solutions.
Process Mapping and Documentation: Proficiency in business process management and experience with BPMN 2.0 process flows are a plus. (BPMN is not a must and can be learnt on the job.)
Project & Change Management: Familiarity with project and change management principles to manage process improvement initiatives and meet deadlines.
Continuous Improvement Mindset: A solid understanding of agile and lean methodologies.


What We Offer


The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;
Support for a healthy lifestyle;
Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
Company retreat facility;
Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
And more


If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:


A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
If available: reference letters and certificates.


About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Initiatives

At MDPI, we develop and maintain various platforms in order to better serve the scientific community. Please find here-below a list of our main platforms:



https://www.mdpi.com

https://www.mdpi.com/books/

https://sciprofiles.com

https://sciforum.net

https://www.scilit.net

https://www.preprints.org

https://encyclopedia.pub

Title: Data Analytics Intern
Description:
Position Snapshot

Location: Vevey, Switzerland

Company: Société des Produits Nestlé S.A.

Act. Rate: At least 50% - Flexible

Type of contract: Internship, 6 months

What We Offer At Nestlé

International, diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment : Read more about our Nestlé Community

Opportunities to have an impact and contribute to your team’s success!

Endless learning opportunities and enriching experiences!

Strong mentorship for your professional growth

Professional network and route to entry level position

Position Summary

As a Data Analytics Intern, you will be part of the Data Analytics team at Nestlé's Internal Audit (NIA) unit, located in the Nestlé HQ in Vevey.

We offer a dynamic, inclusive, and international working environment with many opportunities across different businesses, functions, and regions. Don’t miss the opportunity to join us and work with different teams in an agile and diverse context.

A Day in the Life of a Data Analytics Intern

60% of the time:


Collaborate on a day-by-day basis with your managers, in providing data analytics support to internal auditors, updating documentation, and developing ad-hoc solutions in Databricks (R) and MS Power BI


40% of the time:


Expand Analytical Packages (Deep Dive)
Engage with internal auditors and subject matter experts to design the scripts
Test scripts during audits
Develop new scripts in the area of Sales and Supply to complement existing solutions


What Will Make You Successful


Student in Master degree in Management or equivalent
A strong interest to work in a multinational environment, and in the world of control and audit. Being interested to join Nestlé as an Operational Internal Auditor is a plus
Good R knowledge as well in Microsoft Excel
Previous experience in MS Power BI Desktop a plus
Fluent in English


At Nestlé, we want to help shape a better and healthier world, inspire people to live healthier lives and deliver impact at a scale and pace that makes a difference. We do this by fostering a diverse, friendly, supportive, and collaborative environment, that creates positive disruption, embraces innovation, and empowers people and teams to win.

We aim to hire friendly, respectful, inspiring people who care about the people’s lives that we touch every single day.

Be a force for good. Join Nestlé and visit us on www.nestle.com.

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Profil du candidat


You hold a master’s degree in engineering / finance or an equivalent.
You have 2-3 years’ experience in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component.
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activités

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst with the Deputy Head of Energy Data Management on the team is responsible for the reconciliation, P&L explanation and invoice-able amount of nearly 1.8 billion Euros from these group affiliated contracts a year with growth expected. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub.

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeters, is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst as part of the Trading Support department is responsible to ensure reconciliations with group affiliates.

Energy Data Portfolio Analyst will work with Trading Systems team to ensure systems can manage contracts that fits the needs of all departments such as Front Office, Middle Office, Back Office and Finance departments. Contracts can include but not limited to Power Purchase Agreements, Procurement of Gas and Power for industrial sites of the affiliates, Energy Mechanisms, and Gas Sales Agreements

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Reconciling group affiliated contracts and booking of actualization of contract into trading system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Produce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.
Show more

Title: Internship - Data analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Work Your Magic with us!

Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you’ve got big plans – so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people’s lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.

United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.

Start date: February 2025

Duration: 6 months

Location: Aubonne, Switzerland

Your Role


Collect and analyze data for various products or services offered by the company.
Contribute to creating performance reports and dashboards using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or AERA
Support the business to creating dashboard that allow the identification of trends, patterns, or anomalies that might indicate issues or opportunities for improvement.
Resolve technical and functional issues on existing dashboards.
Interact cross-functionally and capture user requirements and business needs to provide dashboards and increase efficiency for various internal stakeholders.
Participate in team meetings, workshops, and training sessions to develop skills and knowledge.
Provide training and help end-users learn how to use the dashboards.


Your Profil


Currently pursuing a master’s degree in business administration, computer science or related field and willing to learn about the healthcare industry
Excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skills
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, AERA and Knowledge in SQL database and experience with cloud platforms are strong pluses.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and passion for innovation, business development, and entrepreneurship and strong work ethic, self-starter, and team player
Fluent English communication, both written and spoken, with additional language skills like French are considered advantageous


What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We celebrate all dimensions of diversity and believe that it drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of our diverse team!
Show more
HTML:
Work Your Magic with us!

Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you’ve got big plans – so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people’s lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.

United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.

Start date: February 2025

Duration: 6 months

Location: Aubonne, Switzerland

Your Role

  • Collect and analyze data for various products or services offered by the company.
  • Contribute to creating performance reports and dashboards using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or AERA
  • Support the business to creating dashboard that allow the identification of trends, patterns, or anomalies that might indicate issues or opportunities for improvement.
  • Resolve technical and functional issues on existing dashboards.
  • Interact cross-functionally and capture user requirements and business needs to provide dashboards and increase efficiency for various internal stakeholders.
  • Participate in team meetings, workshops, and training sessions to develop skills and knowledge.
  • Provide training and help end-users learn how to use the dashboards.

Your Profil

  • Currently pursuing a master’s degree in business administration, computer science or related field and willing to learn about the healthcare industry
  • Excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skills
  • Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, AERA and Knowledge in SQL database and experience with cloud platforms are strong pluses.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team and passion for innovation, business development, and entrepreneurship and strong work ethic, self-starter, and team player
  • Fluent English communication, both written and spoken, with additional language skills like French are considered advantageous

What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We celebrate all dimensions of diversity and believe that it drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of our diverse team!

Title: Data Analyst 100% (m/w/d)
Description:
Eintritt: Ab sofort oder nach Vereinbarung

Arbeitsort: Döttingen

Aufgaben


Zusammenführen von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Datenbeständen unterschiedlicher Formate aus unterschiedlichen Datenquellen
Aufbereiten zusammengeführter Daten für ihre Auswertung in Analyse-Werkzeugen
Erkennen von relevanten Mustern in Daten
Analysieren von Zusammenhängen in Daten
Erstellen von Datenanalysen mit modernen Methoden des Data Mining und Machine Learning
Erstellen von Reports zu Datenanalysen
Entwickeln und Anwenden komplexer Algorithmen für das Ermitteln von Ursache-Wirkungs-Zusammenhängen sowie für das
Erstellen von quantitativen Prognosemodellen
Definieren von Anforderungen an Datenanalyse-Systeme
Konzipieren, Realisieren und Betreiben von ICT-Analyse-Infrastrukturen und -Werkzeugen
Integrieren automatisierter Datenanalysen in ICT-Prozesse
Beraten bei der Durchführung von Auswertungen sowie bei der Optimierung von Datenanalysen
Mitgestalten einer unternehmensweiten Datenarchitektur
Erstellen von Daten-, Funktions- und/oder Objektmodellen
Implementieren von Schnittstellen zu Datenbanken und anderen Applikationen
Pflegen der Dokumentation von ICT-Analyse-Infrastrukturen und -Werkzeugen


Qualifikation


Abgeschlossene Ausbildung im Bereich Informatik, allenfalls durch ein Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik ergänzt
Mehrere Jahre Erfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Funktion
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Datenanalysetools
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierungstools
Muttersprache Deutsch
Ausgezeichnete analytische Fähigkeiten und ein hohes Maß an Detailgenauigkeit
Teamfähigkeit, Kommunikationsstärke und eine proaktive Arbeitsweise


Es erwartet Sie eine verantwortungsvolle Aufgabe und ein motiviertes Team.

Verfügen Sie über die entsprechenden Erfahrungen und arbeiten motiviert und

teamorientiert? Dann sind Sie die richtige Person für unseren Kunden und wir freuen uns auf Sie!

Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Gerne steht Ihnen auch Herr Rolf Kunz

Geschäftsführer unter +41 56 249 40 04 oder per Mail zur Verfügung.

Title: Business (insights) Data Analyst
Description:
In 2013, while living abroad, our founders set out to create an online tool that could turn huge PDFs into small, easy-to-send versions in order to send updates to their families. As it turns out, they weren't the only ones with this problem. 10 years later, Smallpdf is one of the most popular PDF tools in the world and among the most visited websites globally. With products available in 24 languages, the site has visitors from every single country in the world, plus Antarctica, and processes millions of documents each day.

In 2022, we took a big step forward by acquiring PDF Tools, a Zurich-based pioneer for products that help to create, manipulate, and validate PDF- and PDF/A- files to support and improve our customers’ document workflows.

As a team of over >100 people from 34 nationalities in our offices in Zurich, Belgrade, and Barcelona, we're proud to have made PDFs and life a little bit easier for over a billion customers across our web, mobile, and desktop applications. Our reputation for Swiss engineering standards has made us a trusted choice for industry leaders like Lufthansa, UBS, Swiss Life, and millions of people worldwide.




Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly analytical and strategic Business Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing large datasets, deriving actionable insights, and driving commercial initiatives to enhance business performance. You will collaborate with Product, Monetization, Marketing, Finance and Data teams to develop data-driven strategies that improve decision-making and foster business growth.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with teams (Product, Monetization, Marketing, Finance) to understand data needs.
Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to track key business metrics and performance.
Translate data into actionable business insights, presenting clear and compelling recommendations to stakeholders to guide strategy, decision-making, and commercial initiatives.
Drive the execution of commercial initiatives based on data insights, ensuring measurable impact on business outcomes.
Formulate and test data-driven hypotheses through experimentation, designing and analyzing A/B tests for pricing, product, and marketing to optimize revenue, profitability, and user engagement.
Continuously monitor and report on the ROI of implemented strategies, recommending iterative improvements.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related field. A Master’s degree is a plus.
Fluent English skills (oral and written)
2-5 years of experience in a data analytics role, preferably within a commercial or business-focused environment.
Proficiency in developing, optimizing and validating SQL queries.
Strong data visualization skills using tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
A keen understanding of business strategy and how data can influence decision-making.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
The capacity to examine business requirements across various functional areas and translate them into KPIs, insights, data models and dashboards.
Effective communication and presentation skills to convey complex data findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Nice to Have:

Experience building advanced data models and data models using Python, R or similar.
Experience with predictive analytics, machine learning, or advanced statistical methods.
Past experience working in a tech-driven company with direct-to-consumer (D2C) sales through a digital platform or website.




Why Smallpdf?

Here, every task and challenge is an opportunity to innovate and make a genuine impact. We're a driven team - pragmatic, goal-focused, and always eager to solve the next big problem. This isn’t a place for mere management or grand visions detached from reality; it’s a ground for hands-on champions ready to roll up their sleeves. If you're someone who's willing to dive deep into the action, someone who's more about the journey than just the title, Smallpdf is your destination.




Our benefits

🌍 You get to impact how over 60 million people get work done monthly.

🚀 Push boundaries and dare to fail—that’s how we learn!

🏝️ 30 vacation days—yep, you read that right— you can take them whenever you need them.

🧳 Need a long break? We offer sabbatical leave to employees who’ve been with us for over two years.

👶 16 weeks parental leave—100% of your salary—for all new parents.

🐶 Don’t leave your four-legged friends at home; our offices are pet-friendly.

📚 A personal development budget of up to 2,000 CHF every year, plus days off for courses or training.

🥧 Possibility of a Phantom stock option plan (PSOP). (Conditions apply.)

🧑‍🏫 We offer 1-1 coaching sessions to individual contributors and employees in leadership positions through our external partner 'BetterUp'.

👩‍💻 Hack days to challenge you and your team, plus build amazing things.




Smallpdf is an equal-opportunity employer. We believe our greatest strength is a talented, diverse, and inclusive workforce. We strongly oppose any form of hiring or workplace discrimination against candidates or employees on any basis, including race, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, philosophy, nationality, disability, or genetic information. We’re committed to fostering a safe, supportive environment where everyone can come to work as their full selves and reach their greatest potential.

Submitting your application allows Smallpdf to handle and store your data.

Smallpdf does not seek or accept unsolicited applications or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for and will not pay any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited applications or CVs except as required in a written contract between Smallpdf and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Do your qualifications and experience not exactly match all requirements of the job?

At MSF OCG, we are committed to an inclusive culture that supports and amplifies the diverse voices of our staff members. We strive to create workplaces where teams of people with diverse backgrounds, characteristics, perspectives, ideas and experiences work together to advance MSF's social mission and create better outcomes for our patients and the communities we work with.

We understand that some people may hesitate to apply for employment if they don't meet all listed job requirements. Research shows that this is especially true for women. If you believe your profile is a good match for this position, we invite you to apply even if you don’t fulfil every listed qualification.

We encourage applications from individuals of all genders, ages, sexual orientations, ethnicities, background, religions, beliefs, ability status, and all other diversity characteristics.

MSF does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of discrimination or harassment, including sexual harassment. All selected candidates will undergo reference checks.

Would you like to join a multicultural and cross-functional team to solve exciting data challenges, and make a real impact with MSF teams on the field?

If the answer is yes, apply now to meet Deborah, Mohammed, Patrice, Francois and cie and learn more about this great opportunity!




Context & Mission

Médecins Sans Frontières is an independent, international medical and humanitarian organization that provides care to people in need, people affected by natural or man-made disasters, and victims of armed conflict, without discrimination and without regard to race, religion, creed or political affiliation (MSF Charter).

The MSF movement is built around 5 operational centers supported by 24 sections and offices worldwide. MSF Operational Center Geneva (MSF OCG) is one of these centers.

MSF OCG employs approximately 450 HQ staff located primarily in Geneva with teams in Zurich, Dakar and Amman and another 6,000 internationally mobile staff located in 30 countries worldwide working across 110 of our humanitarian projects.

MSF, including OCG, has grown significantly over the last 10 years and until now the HR department has managed that expansion with ad-hoc tools and methods.

To better support the ongoing demands and better serve our global workforce, OCG has launched a transformative HR initiative with one critical pillar being the introduction of an HR Information System (HRIS).

Joining a dynamic team of HR professionals, the IT Data Analyst will analyse the as-is and define the to-be data structure and flow required to support the data migration activities and implementation of HRIS integration. They will produce deliverables based on guideline and methodology provided by Data by the Data architect. The incumbent will collaborate with IT Business Analysts, Functional Referrents, HR SMEs, Data Migration specialists and Integration team to produce relevant artefacts and deliver a robust data migration process and the integration between HRIS component and peripheral systems. The HR Data Analyst will report to the Data Lead and IT Project Manager.

At MSF you will be part of a diverse and inclusive team dedicated to making a meaningful impact in the world. You will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, collaborate with passionate colleagues, and contribute to positive change on a global scale.




Responsibilities

As the HR Data Analyst, your role is pivotal in optimizing our human resources data infrastructure to support the delivery of end-to-end HRIS solutions encompassing the deployment of a new HR solution (Workday) loaded with HR data (current and historical), inbound and outbound integrations.

You will:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand and document data requirements and priorities
Contribution to the production of data quality standards in our HRIS, ensuring accurate reporting and compliance
Define the integration flow of data across the relevant systems to ensure data consistency and accuracy
Cultivate collaborative relationships with IT business analysts, application managers and functional referrents to align data with business processes
Identify data requirements and workflows for an effective HRIS implementation
Design our HR data flows, data mapping and conversion rules for the data migration
Extract source data, develop conversion scripts, reconciliation scripts and continuously improve them through-out the end-to-end delivery lifecycle
Analyse data quality for in the context of data migration and system integration, recognise patterns and make recommendations to the team
Work closely with the Data Protection Officer to ensure compliance with regulations
Control the quality of the data team’s deliverables (e.g. peer review) and test the data outputs generated by data migration scripts and system integrations tools
Support and participate to the program’s testing activities
Submit deliverables for review and feedback by the Data Architect. Incorporate feedback




Your Profile

Experience

Proven track record in data modelling and analysis, ideally with HR and in an international environment
Experience in data migration, integration and reporting
Experience in development of data migration scripts (extraction, conversion, reconciliation, cleansing)
Has contributed to an end-to-end vision for the data integrity across various applications across a given landscape (ideally HR data integrated with Active Directory, payroll, and other consumers of HR data)

Experience with

HRIS platforms
HR analytics tools
Datawarehousing
ETL Processes
Data modelling and development tools

Languages

English and French are the working languages of MSF Switzerland. Fluency in both English and French is required for this position (oral and written).

Skills/ Technical competencies

Excellent proficiency in data analysis, data modeling, and using these skills to influence process definition.
Proficiency with data management tools, with the ability to implement them effectively in a low data maturity context.
Ability to work within cross-functional teams on strategic projects, bringing a data-focused perspective: data catalog, data cleansing, data migration.
Strong communication skills and active collaboration to design the desired data flow and structure.
Ability to collaborate with IT, HR, legal, and compliance teams to ensure data security.
Previous experience as a data analyst is required, with experience in HR projects being a plus
Familiar with requirements and knownledge management tools such as Jira, Microsoft Sharepoint, Visio

Personal Abilities/Qualities

Analytical and organized
Pragmatic
Positive, good communicator
Collaborative and a team player
Great documentation skills
Ability to link functional requirements with data




Terms of Employment

Vacancy for 2 positions
Full-time position 100% (40h/week)
Fixed-term contract, 18 months
Working place: Geneva, Switzerland
Ideal start date: January 6th, 2025
Gross annual salary (for 100%): from CHF 93’504.- to CHF 107’280.- (salary commensurate with equivalent experience and internal salary grid)
Paid vacation: 25 days per year, prorate temporis, plus any Swiss public holidays falling within the contract period.
Pension plan: pension contribution covered 3/4 by MSF, 1/4 by staff member.
Relocation package if moving from a different country to Switzerland.




How to apply

Candidates submit their application following the requirements: CV 2 p. max. – letter of motivation 1p. max. – in French or English.

Deadline for application is November 3rd, 2024.

We reserve the right to close the position early if we consider the number and quality of applications received to be sufficient.

APPLY HERE

The applications will be treated confidentially.

Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Only applications submitted on our recruitment platforms will be considered.

Please note that we do not wish to use the services of recruitment or placement agencies.

  • Experience in data migration, integration and reporting

  • Has contributed to an end-to-end vision for the data integrity across various applications across a given landscape (ideally HR data integrated with Active Directory, payroll, and other consumers of HR data)

Experience with

  • HRIS platforms

  • Datawarehousing
  • ETL Processes
  • Data modelling and development tools

Languages

  • Proficiency with data management tools, with the ability to implement them effectively in a low data maturity context.
  • Ability to work within cross-functional teams on strategic projects, bringing a data-focused perspective: data catalog, data cleansing, data migration.
  • Strong communication skills and active collaboration to design the desired data flow and structure.
  • Ability to collaborate with IT, HR, legal, and compliance teams to ensure data security.
  • Previous experience as a data analyst is required, with experience in HR projects being a plus
  • Familiar with requirements and knownledge management tools such as Jira, Microsoft Sharepoint, Visio

  • Working place: Geneva, Switzerland
  • Ideal start date: January 6th, 2025
  • Gross annual salary (for 100%): from CHF 93’504.- to CHF 107’280.- (salary commensurate with equivalent experience and internal salary grid)
  • Paid vacation: 25 days per year, prorate temporis, plus any Swiss public holidays falling within the contract period.
  • Pension plan: pension contribution covered 3/4 by MSF, 1/4 by staff member.
  • Relocation package if moving from a different country to Switzerland.


How to apply

Candidates submit their application following the requirements: CV 2 p. max. – letter of motivation 1p. max. – in French or English.

Deadline for application is November 3rd, 2024.

We reserve the right to close the position early if we consider the number and quality of applications received to be sufficient.

APPLY HERE

The applications will be treated confidentially.

Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Only applications submitted on our recruitment platforms will be considered.

Please note that we do not wish to use the services of recruitment or placement agencies.

Title: Data Engineer - Power BI
Description:
Keyteo recherche un Consultant Power BI pour rejoindre son équipe dynamique ! Si vous êtes passionné par les technologies de data visualization et avez une forte expertise dans l'utilisation de Power BI, ce poste est fait pour vous.




Vos principales responsabilités :

Chargement et transformation de données sur Power BI : vous serez en charge de concevoir et réaliser des visuels performants et adaptés aux besoins des utilisateurs.
Gestion de la sécurité des données : vous maîtrisez les mécanismes de sécurité liés à l’accès aux données sur Power BI et Report Server.
Exploitation de bases de données : vous avez une expertise en SQL sur au moins une des bases suivantes : Oracle, PostgreSQL ou SQL Server, ainsi que dans les techniques de manipulation et interrogation de données.
Accompagnement et formation : fort de vos expériences réussies, vous accompagnerez et formerez les utilisateurs dans l’utilisation de Power BI et dans la mise en place de tableaux de bord sur mesure.
Documentation et qualité des données : vous rédigerez des documentations utilisateurs, définirez les spécifications des traitements d’intégration de données, et mettrez en place des règles de contrôle qualité rigoureuses.

Profil recherché :

Maîtrise avancée de Power BI (chargement, transformation, conception visuelle)
Expertise en sécurité des données
Solide expérience en SQL et manipulation de bases de données (Oracle, PostgreSQL, SQL Server)
Capacité à former et accompagner des utilisateurs avec pédagogie
Expérience dans la rédaction de documentation utilisateur et la mise en place de process de contrôle qualité

Envie de relever un nouveau défi dans un environnement stimulant ? Rejoignez Keyteo et contribuez à transformer la donnée en valeur ajoutée pour nos clients !
