Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Profil du candidat


You are a young graduate and have demonstrated a first successful experience as a Data Engineer with a background in PySpark, AWS, DataOps, and/or DevOps.
You have strong programming skills in languages such as Python and SQL.
You have a previous experience with data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing.
You show a strong interest for the commodities trading or energy sectors.
You are an excellent problem-solver and you pay attention to detail.
You have strong communication skills and the ability to work in a team environment.



Activités

Are you a Data Engineer with a passion for innovation and problem-solving? We are looking for a talented individual with expertise in Databricks, AWS, DataOps and/or DevOps to join our team and help us harness the power of data.

Key Responsibilities:


Design and implement complex data solutions using Databricks and AWS.
Develop and maintain scalable and reliable data pipelines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality data solutions.
Implement DataOps and DevOps best practices to improve the efficiency and quality of data delivery.
Monitor and optimize data systems to ensure optimal performance.



What We Offer:


A dynamic and challenging work environment with opportunities for growth and development.
A collaborative team that values innovation and creativity.
A commitment to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.



If you are a Data Engineer looking for an exciting new challenge and the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, we would love to hear from you. Apply now and take the next step in your career with us!

Contexte et environnement

Role Overview: As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in developing and maintaining our data infrastructure. You will work closely with our team to design, build, and optimize data pipelines, ensuring the highest quality of data availability and accuracy.

Title: Global Graduate Program - Quantitative Analysis/Data Science
Description:
Job Title:

Global Graduate Program - Quantitative Analysis/Data Science

Contract Type:

Permanent

Time Type:

Full time

Job Description:

Are you ready to dive into the dynamic world of commodities trading and data science?

At Gunvor, we're on a mission to empower the next generation of talent in the industry. Our Global Graduate Program is your gateway to an incredible adventure, where you'll build the skills and knowledge that will set you on the path to success.

Your role:

As a Quantitative Analysis/Data Scientist Graduate at Gunvor, you will play a crucial role in our data analytics and research team. This 12-month rotational program will provide you with hands-on experience in quantitative analysis, data science, and market research. You will have the opportunity to work on real projects and gain valuable insights into the commodities trading industry.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyze market data to identify trends and patterns.
Develop quantitative models and algorithms.
Collaborate with our market research team.
Gain exposure to trading strategies and risk management.



Qualifications:


Recent university's degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields.
0-12 months of work experience (ideally in commodities).
Strong numerical aptitude and coding skills (Python, C#).
Proficiency in statistical analysis.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to dynamic market conditions.



What We Offer:


A structured and comprehensive training program.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities for personal and professional development.
A competitive compensation package.



Selection Process:

Our selection process is designed to find the brightest talents who are eager to embark on this incredible journey. Here's how it works:

Application Window: We look forward to receiving your applications between the 1st of October and the 30th of October 2024.

Screening & Assessment (Up until December, 2024): Our recruiters will diligently screen applications as they are submitted and match the information to our selection criteria.


Assessment: If your application passes the initial review, you'll be invited to participate in our online assessments. Here, we get to see your numerical, cognitive, and problem-solving skills.
Initial Interview: Successful candidates from the assessments will proceed to an interview where we'll discuss your qualifications, experiences, and your passion for the commodities trading world.



Selection Days (January 2025): The final stage includes our face-to-face Selection Days, scheduled for January 2025. This is a fantastic opportunity for us to get to know you better, and for you to learn more about Gunvor.

If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Für unseren Kunden im Raum Zürich, suchen wir schnellstmöglich eine/n:




Data Engineer, 80-100% (w,m,d) - 7490




Ihr Verantwortungsbereich:

Sie organisieren den reibungslosen Betrieb der produktiven Datenbanken
Sie sind für die Monitoring & Alerting Infrastruktur für Datenbanken verantwortlich
Sie empfangen, bearbeiten Incidents und Fehlermeldungen aus den Applikationen gezielt und fachgerecht
Sie stellen sicher, dass die Deployment-Infrastruktur für Datenbanken funktioniert
Sie sorgen für die Weiterentwicklung und Stabilität des Daten-Synchronisations-Framework auf Basis vom SQL Server




Ihr Profil:

Sie haben ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Sie haben langjährige Erfahrung mit Microsoft SQL Server in der Rolle als DBA
Sie punkten mit Expertise bei der Entwicklung von Stored Procedures in T-SQL sowie Query Optimierungen, Query Plans und Index Erstellung
Sie bringen Kenntnisse von SQL Azure mit sowie fundierte Erfahrung in der Datenmodellierung
Sie begeistern sich für agile Projektarbeit und sind verhandlungssicher in Deutsch und Englisch




Vertragliches:

Festanstellung
Start: 01.10.2024 (oder nach Vereinbarung)
Ort: Zürich
Pensum: 100%




Ihre Benefits

Wir unterstützen unsere Mitarbeitenden dabei, ihre berufliche Entwicklung und ihr Privatleben in allen Lebensphasen optimal zu gestalten. Unsere attraktiven Leistungen wie die Möglichkeit der Heimarbeit, 25 bis 30 Urlaubstage, Prämienbeiträge in der 3. Säule und ein breites Angebot an Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten tragen dazu bei.




Wichtige Auskunft:

Bitte bewerben Sie sich nur auf diese Stelle, wenn Sie folgende Voraussetzungen erfüllen:

Einen europäischen Reisepass oder eine gültige Schweizer Arbeitsbewilligung
fliessend Deutsch sprechen







Kontakt

Als freundliche und dynamische IT-Personalberatung ist IT Di-Visions AG bei namhaften Kunden in der gesamten Schweiz sehr erfolgreich etabliert. Wir vermitteln IT-Experten sowohl für Projekte auf Zeit als auch für Stellen auf Dauer.




Herr Anj Carter steht Ihnen bei fachlichen Fragen unter der Tel. Nr. 044 213 20 30 gerne zur Verfügung.




IT Di-Visions AG

Bahnhofstrasse 63

8001 Zürich

aca@di-visions.ch

Tel +41 44 213 20 30

Fax +41 44 213 20 31

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Akkodis, is a global leader in the engineering and R&D market that is leveraging the power of connected data to accelerate innovation and digital transformation. With a shared passion for technology and talent, 50,000 engineers and digital experts deliver deep cross-sector expertise in 30 countries across North America, EMEA and APAC.




Akkodis offers broad industry experience, and strong know-how in key technology sectors such as mobility, software & technology services, robotics, testing, simulations, data security, AI & data analytics. The combined IT and engineering expertise brings a unique end-to-end solution offering, with four service lines – Consulting, Solutions, Talents and Academy – to support clients in rethinking their product development and business processes, improve productivity, minimize time to market and shape a smarter and more sustainable tomorrow. Akkodis is part of the Adecco Group.







Context




La mission est de concevoir, réaliser et déployer des solutions décisionnelles au travers des outils standards du secteur en réponse aux demandes faites au secteur informatique décisionnelle.




Responsabilities




Supervisé par un responsable fonctionnel, vos activités seront conduites dans le respect des processus en vigueur, des contraintes des systèmes et des bonnes pratiques d’architecture et de développement.

Intégré à une équipe d’une dizaine de personnes, vous serez en charge de

Chiffrer, analyser, concevoir, réaliser et maintenir les solutions décisionnelles mises en place par le secteur sur la plateforme PowerBI pour garantir des résultats conformes aux exigences formulées (qualité, performance, délai et sécurité)
Accompagner les data analystes sur la mise à disposition des données et fournir l’expertise nécessaire à la modélisation /la réalisation des analyses et tableaux de bord.
Participer à la gestion des incidents, des changements et des déploiements.







Required Skills




Capacité à partager ses connaissances et à travailler en équipe
Forte autonomie technique, forte capacité d'analyse et de compréhension
Excellente capacité à résoudre des problèmes techniques et être force de proposition
Rigueur dans les réalisations et le respect des processus




Technical skills

Maîtrise des techniques PowerBI de chargement et transformation des données, de conception et de réalisation des visuels PowerBI
Maîtrise des mécanismes de sécurité des accès aux données (PowerBI / report server)
Maitrise du SQL (Oracle, Postgré, SQLserver)
Accompagnement et formation des utilisateurs
Expériences dans la rédaction de documentation
Connaissances des bonnes pratiques ITIL, d’une organisation orientée service et de la conduite de projet HERMES ou agile
Expériences dans les connexions aux différents sources de données (bd, api, json, xml)
Très bonnes connaissances des modèles d’entrepôts de données.
Connaissances de QlikSense ou IBM Cognos




Qualifications

Bachelor Université ou diplôme équivalent + DAS
Certification PowerBI

Show more

Title: Consulting & Analytics Summer Intern
Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive.

When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.

Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) teams are focused in helping key clients that include global banks and retailers and other merchants, as well as local FinTech’s and governments. Our goal is to help clients solve strategic payment challenges and identify opportunities by supporting in benchmarking, ideation, definition, implementation and monitoring of recommendations. Resulting in our clients receiving end-to-end support that help them achieve scale, competitive advantage, and speed to market in the digital age. Exemplary projects:


How can a retail bank drive activation and usage of payment solutions (e.g., cards) in specific customer segments?
How can an airline build and enhance its payment value proposition for consumers and/or small businesses?
How can a credit card issuer use emerging technologies like open banking to acquire new customers?
How can an acquirer or merchant better understand customer loyalty?


VCA engages clients throughout Europe and is organised in teams within, UK & Ireland, South Europe, FBL, Nordics & Baltics, Central Eastern Europe, and Central Europe

Day to day responsibilities of an Intern Consultant:


Help drive business insights with data gathering and market trend analysis thanks to our superb data analytics powered by Visa data.
Support the VCA team in the delivery of projects for Internal Visa projects and clients across various domains, from payments, digital, products to strategy.
Develop, with assistance from your manager, VCA project deliverables (based in PowerPoint, excel, etc.) for assigned clients.


Visa’s Summer Intern Programme:

Our Summer Internship is an 11-week programme providing you the opportunity to experience all that Visa has to offer alongside completing challenging work, building your skillset, and networking with fellow interns and Visa employees. Throughout the internship you will work on BAU work within your team, be given an end-to-end project to complete and take part in a variety of trainings to increase your learning. You will also get the opportunity to take part in a global social impact case challenge as well as hearing from senior leaders through our Visa Executive Speaker Series. The internship is just the beginning of what we hope will be a lasting career at Visa! If you are successful throughout your internship, you could even secure a graduate role with us when you finish university.

Our 2 Summer Intern cohort dates are:


10th June- 22nd August
1st July – 19th September


By joining VCA as a Summer Intern you will:


Work alongside an experienced and dynamic team, as well as top clients, expanding your knowledge in the payments sector and our consulting practices.
Gain access to ad hoc training resources such as Buddy, Mentor, your own learning path, project coaching and more to accelerate your career plan, such as Visa University.
Develop your management consulting skills in a market leader consulting organization, with top-notch practices


Qualifications

Visa Europe is home to a talented team of 15,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. Our campaign YOUniqueness, Accepted Everywhere is all about allowing our team to unleash the talent and potential that is uniquely their own. We’re looking for the next generation of change agents – dreamers and creatives - who are fascinated by new technology and want to be empowered to change the way business is done.

Therefore, our requirements are few:


Be in your penultimate year of university, including any further master's degrees or courses. Meaning your education will be complete in 2026.
Full, permanent, right to work for the location you applying to. Visa will not provide sponsorship for this role.
Fluent in both English and local language
Interest in technology and the payments industry


Desired Skills:


Strong communication skills – Oral and written fluency in local language and English is required.
Curious mindset with an interest in solving problems alongside strong analytical and quantitative skills, driving insight from data analysis.
Proactive attitude with experience of being a self-starter, a willingness to learn and to think creatively and identify new ways to innovate.


Additional Information

If you require any support during the recruitment process for any reasons, including those related to a disability, please let us know and we will be in contact to discuss this with you.

This is a hybrid position, employees are expected to work from the office 3 days a week (determined by leadership/site),

Please submit your CV in English. 

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive.

When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.

Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) teams are focused in helping key clients that include global banks and retailers and other merchants, as well as local FinTech’s and governments. Our goal is to help clients solve strategic payment challenges and identify opportunities by supporting in benchmarking, ideation, definition, implementation and monitoring of recommendations. Resulting in our clients receiving end-to-end support that help them achieve scale, competitive advantage, and speed to market in the digital age. Exemplary projects:

  • How can a retail bank drive activation and usage of payment solutions (e.g., cards) in specific customer segments?
  • How can an airline build and enhance its payment value proposition for consumers and/or small businesses?
  • How can a credit card issuer use emerging technologies like open banking to acquire new customers?
  • How can an acquirer or merchant better understand customer loyalty?

VCA engages clients throughout Europe and is organised in teams within, UK & Ireland, South Europe, FBL, Nordics & Baltics, Central Eastern Europe, and Central Europe

Day to day responsibilities of an Intern Consultant:

  • Help drive business insights with data gathering and market trend analysis thanks to our superb data analytics powered by Visa data.
  • Support the VCA team in the delivery of projects for Internal Visa projects and clients across various domains, from payments, digital, products to strategy.
  • Develop, with assistance from your manager, VCA project deliverables (based in PowerPoint, excel, etc.) for assigned clients.

Visa’s Summer Intern Programme:

Our Summer Internship is an 11-week programme providing you the opportunity to experience all that Visa has to offer alongside completing challenging work, building your skillset, and networking with fellow interns and Visa employees. Throughout the internship you will work on BAU work within your team, be given an end-to-end project to complete and take part in a variety of trainings to increase your learning. You will also get the opportunity to take part in a global social impact case challenge as well as hearing from senior leaders through our Visa Executive Speaker Series. The internship is just the beginning of what we hope will be a lasting career at Visa! If you are successful throughout your internship, you could even secure a graduate role with us when you finish university.

Our 2 Summer Intern cohort dates are:

  • 10th June- 22nd August
  • 1st July – 19th September

By joining VCA as a Summer Intern you will:

  • Work alongside an experienced and dynamic team, as well as top clients, expanding your knowledge in the payments sector and our consulting practices.
  • Gain access to ad hoc training resources such as Buddy, Mentor, your own learning path, project coaching and more to accelerate your career plan, such as Visa University.
  • Develop your management consulting skills in a market leader consulting organization, with top-notch practices

Qualifications

Visa Europe is home to a talented team of 15,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. Our campaign YOUniqueness, Accepted Everywhere is all about allowing our team to unleash the talent and potential that is uniquely their own. We’re looking for the next generation of change agents – dreamers and creatives - who are fascinated by new technology and want to be empowered to change the way business is done.

Therefore, our requirements are few:

  • Be in your penultimate year of university, including any further master's degrees or courses. Meaning your education will be complete in 2026.
  • Full, permanent, right to work for the location you applying to. Visa will not provide sponsorship for this role.
  • Fluent in both English and local language
  • Interest in technology and the payments industry

Desired Skills:

  • Strong communication skills – Oral and written fluency in local language and English is required.
  • Curious mindset with an interest in solving problems alongside strong analytical and quantitative skills, driving insight from data analysis.
  • Proactive attitude with experience of being a self-starter, a willingness to learn and to think creatively and identify new ways to innovate.

Additional Information

If you require any support during the recruitment process for any reasons, including those related to a disability, please let us know and we will be in contact to discuss this with you.

This is a hybrid position, employees are expected to work from the office 3 days a week (determined by leadership/site),

Please submit your CV in English. 

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Junior Financial Data Analyst - Graduate (Hybrid, m/f/x/d)
Description:
We are looking for graduates with strong interpersonal skills, who are eager to learn, broaden their knowledge and expertise and want to make a difference. You have a Bachelor, Master, or PhD degree with less than 3 years of professional experience - we invite you to apply to our Graduate Programme which officially starts on 1 September 2025.

The programme offers you the chance to join the dynamic, fast-moving world of a leading risk knowledge organisation. Over an 18-month period, you will receive on- and off-the-job training, including a job rotation that gives you the opportunity to work across different lines of business and departments.

About The Team

The Market Risk Management (MRM) team within the Solvency & Financial Risk Management department will be your homebase during the programme and you will also have the opportunity to complete one or two rotations of 16-20 weeks total (possible destinations could, e.g., be Treasury / AM / other areas of the Solvency & Financial Risk Management department such as credit risk management, risk modelling, financial model validation). The market risk management team has presence in Zurich, London, New York City / Armonk, and Bangalore. The role will work across all three product areas within MRM, i.e., Credit & Equities; Treasury & Rates; and (Re)Insurance Transactions.

About The Role

The cross-functional role will involve deriving risk analytics and developing/maintaining various applications (dashboards, own R packages, APIs) for financial risk managers. The position holder will support the product areas in their regular responsibilities and deliverables and engage in a significant amount of project-based work.

Here are some areas you might focus on:

Scenario impact on risk measures and balance sheet metrics using open-source or commercial frameworks Supporting the management reporting process through execution and enhancement of current reports Data integration across various of the Group's internal and external data sources Design and development of RShiny server dashboards Analysis of embedded financial market risks within reinsurance transactions using the in-house libraries

About You

Essentials:

Master's degree in quantitative subject (e.g., Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Finance) Solid coding skills in at least one major data language (R and/or Python) (A lot of) intellectual curiosity, drive and interest in financial and quantitative topics Fully proficient in English

Nice to Have:

Prior professional experience with financial risk management (quantitative / market / credit etc), treasury or within asset management within the banking or (re)insurance sector

Opportunities for Further Learning and Growth:

MS SQL Server databases and Analysis Services and/or with the DAX query language REST APIs and querying them in R / Python Version control / Git Deep R proficiency incl package development, environment management, code optimization, object-oriented programming (R6 classes), RShiny dashboards, Quarto, code parallelization etc Apache Spark / PySpark

Please note that the application process will be open until beginning of November. The active selection and interview process will start afterwards, and you may not hear from us in the meantime. This does not mean you application is ignored. Please keep this in mind in case you do not hear from us within upcoming weeks. We will keep you informed of any updates or changes to the schedule. Thank you for your understanding.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world's leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Title: BUSINESS DATA ANALYST Junior
Description:
Synergie Italia Spa, Divisione Lazio Direzionale seleziona per Società controllata europea, leader nel comparto automotive


BUSINESS DATA ANALYST


Posizione:

La risorsa sarà inserita nel team Underwriting and Business Development in un contesto di ampio respiro internazionale e si occuperà di:


Interpretare ed analizzare i dati dei sistemi per elaborare la reportistica, utilizzando Excel e software avanzati messi a


disposizione


Definire, controllare e monitorare le tariffe assicurative
Dare supporto nella gestione, implementazione e manutenzione delle funzioni e dei processi della compagnia
Raccogliere e analizzare le esigenze delle diverse linee di business, predisporre le richieste ai fornitori, pianificare forecast e linee di sviluppo


Requisiti:

L'Azienda ricerca neo laureati in discipline matematiche o statistiche. Si valuta anche la laurea in Economia o discipline attuariali.

I candidati devono avere svolto un'esperienza analoga, anche in stage, di almeno 6 o 12 mesi in contesti solidi e procedurali. Si richiede competenza nell'utilizzo di strumenti statistici per l'analisi di serie di dati, buona conoscenza di database relazionali (SQL, ecc.), di pacchetti di reporting (MS PowerBI), e di programmazione. Completano il profilo autonomia nell'utilizzo della suite Microsoft, excel avanzato e inglese fluente, livello B2

Altre informazioni:

Si offre inserimento diretto in Azienda

CCNL COMMERCIO 14 mensilità

RAL da valutare in base al percorso del candidato

Presente accordo di smart working

Si erogano tk restaurant per ogni giornata di lavoro

Sede di lavoro: Roma 00148 Magliana Vecchia

L'offerta è rivolta a candidatə nel rispetto del Dlgs 198/2006 e dei Dlgs 215/2003 e 216/2003.

Le persone interessate sono invitate a leggere l'informativa privacy ex artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. UE 2016/679.

Aut. Min. Prot. N. 1207 – SG del 16/12/2004

Title: Competitive Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Bulgari S.p.A., within the Network Development department based in Rome, is looking for a Competitive Intelligence Analyst.

The selected candidate will perform research on luxury market, leveraging on official publications and industry studies with the objective of identifying relevant data, to build and maintain a solid database to perform relevant analysis of Bulgari main competitors and luxury market trends in general.

Analize and network development projects from a commercial and economic perspective and manage the approval process internally and with the Group.




Accountabilities:




Proactively collect, analyze, and summarize data and information to build reports as well as providing insights.
Study equity research analysis, monitoring companies’ valuation, financial estimates, and target prices.
Design and implement dashboards to constantly monitor performances.
Perform analysis on market share evolution and brands performances.
Analyze financial results (Profit & Loss, Cash Flow, Inventory levels).
Analyze the economic impact of new business model and new trade commercial conditions.
Support network development keeping constant track of opportunities on locations through regular update with the Group and CMDs.
Analyze network opportunities from a commercial and a financial standpoint and manage approval at Brand and Group Level.
Manage the worldwide Commercial CAPEX optimizing resources in alignment with Group priorities.
Keep regular track of rent agreements.




Skills




University degree in Economics or similar
Up to 3 years' experience in a similar position;
Budget & Reporting techniques
Strong numerical ability;
Analytical skills to plan and analyse performance;
Knowledge of fashion & luxury sector
Awareness of retail dynamics
Highly proficient in the use of Microsoft Office with outstanding Excel and Access skills;
Expertise in data analysis and BI tools (i.e. Power BI);
Fluency in English and Italian;
Proactive, flexible, team player, organized and accurate;
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to thoroughly interface with different departments and players involved;
Ability to deal with a high volume of data and complete tasks within tight deadlines.




The ideal candidate is highly goal oriented, able to synthesize the big picture with a pragmatic approach through ad hoc analysis and reports.

Title: Data Analyst junior | Sara Assicurazioni
Description:
All’interno dell’evento DRWlive Sapienza che si terrà il 23 ottobre presso la facoltà di Ingegneria della Sapienza a Roma, SARA assicurazioni ricerca Data Analyst Junior per la sede di Roma.

Sara Assicurazioni investe costantemente nell'analisi e nella gestione dei dati per offrire ai propri clienti soluzioni sempre più personalizzate ed efficaci. L’azienda supporta l’innovazione tramite l’utilizzo di tecnologie avanzate e promuove una cultura aziendale basata sulla collaborazione e l’apprendimento continuo. Con un occhio attento alla diversità, Sara Assicurazioni è impegnata a creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e rispettoso.

Orario di lavoro: Full-time dal lunedì al venerdì

Tipo di contratto: Tempo indeterminato

RAL e benefit: commisurati all’esperienza e al CCNL di riferimento

Posizione:

I/le candidati/e selezionati/e saranno coinvolti/e in progetti finalizzati alla digitalizzazione dei servizi assicurativi, lo sviluppo di applicazioni per la gestione delle polizze, o la creazione di piattaforme online per migliorare l'esperienza dei clienti.

All’interno del team di lavoro si occuperanno di

Raccolta ed estrazione dei dati:


acquisire dati da diverse fonti interne ed esterne, come database aziendali, fogli di calcolo e API, assicurandosi dell'integrità e dell'accuratezza dei dati raccolti.


Pulizia e preparazione dei dati:


pulire, trasformare e organizzare i dati per renderli pronti all'analisi, gestendo valori mancanti, eliminando duplicati e correggendo eventuali errori.


Analisi dei dati:


effettuare analisi statistiche per identificare tendenze, pattern e anomalie che possano fornire insight utili al business.


Visualizzazione e reporting:


creare report, dashboard e visualizzazioni grafiche utilizzando strumenti come Tableau, Power BI o Excel per comunicare efficacemente i risultati ai diversi stakeholder.


Sviluppo di modelli predittivi di base:


supportare la creazione di modelli statistici e predittivi sotto la supervisione di analisti senior, utilizzando linguaggi di programmazione come Python o R.


Requisiti:


Laurea triennale o specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica, Statistica o Matematica
Conoscenza di strumenti di analisi dati (es. Excel, SQL, Python)
Capacità di interpretare e visualizzare dati complessi
Forte attenzione ai dettagli e capacità di risolvere problemi
Team working e capacità di comunicazione efficace


Altre informazioni:

Sara Assicurazioni svolgerà i colloqui durante DRWlive Sapienza che si terrà il 23 ottobre a Roma, dedicata a laureandi e neolaureati in ingegneria in cerca di lavoro.

Per un colloquio con Sara Assicurazioni iscriviti all’evento, sarai ricontattato.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.




To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.




For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.




A few examples of your responsibilities:

Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.




What we look for

Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.




What we offer

Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of €52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.




Commitment & contract

Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.




Location

Milan (Italy) or fully remote.




Before you apply

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We’re extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don’t hesitate to apply.




The selection process

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.




Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.




Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.


To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.


For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.


A few examples of your responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
  • Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
  • Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
  • Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
  • Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.


What we look for

  • Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.

  • Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
  • Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


What we offer

  • An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
  • Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of €52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
  • All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Milan (Italy) or fully remote.


Before you apply

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We’re extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don’t hesitate to apply.


The selection process

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.


Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
About DataCamp

DataCamp's mission is to empower everyone with the data and AI skills essential for 21st-century success. By providing practical, engaging learning experiences, DataCamp equips learners and organizations of all sizes to harness the power of data and AI. As a trusted partner to over 14 million learners and 5,000+ companies, including 80% of the Fortune 1000, DataCamp is leading the charge in addressing the critical data and AI skills shortage.

About the role

As a (Senior) Product Data Analyst at DataCamp, you will play a pivotal role in building and maintaining world-class client reporting capabilities. Reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will ensure that our customers understand the value of our platform by making it easy for them to accurately track how their users are leveraging and improving their skills using DataCamp. You'll be deeply involved in working with the product and customer success teams to optimize our client reporting portal, data connectors (APIs), and internal dashboards.

You will influence changes by bringing data to the table and promoting data-driven development and decision-making. To be successful, you will need to collaborate with a strong team of software engineers, data scientists, data engineers, product managers, and customer success leaders. You will get to do all of this while leveraging DataCamp's rich data and state-of-the-art data science infrastructure.

About you

At DataCamp, we seek individuals who embody our core values of data-driven decision-making, action, transparency, ownership, and customer focus. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-performing environment and are driven by a passion for making a meaningful impact. You're adaptable, embracing change and ambiguity with enthusiasm. Your initiative and entrepreneurial spirit push you beyond just meeting targets—you aim to understand the "why" behind our goals and take ownership to drive the business forward. You're a collaborative team player who values transparency and always seeks to improve and innovate. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply!

Responsibilities


Perform analyses on how our external and internal B2B clients use our reporting tools and services, providing improvement recommendations to the product management team.
Generate and maintain comprehensive internal reports and dashboards for the customer success team to monitor and identify opportunities for our clients.
Ensure high data quality standards by maintaining accuracy and consistency across internal dashboards and client product reporting tools.
Keep our internal documentation, like data dictionaries, up to date and continuously provide recommendations on existing and new metric definitions to ensure our customers can easily use and find value in the data we provide.
Partner with the customer success and learning solutions teams to work on key accounts by attending meetings to help gather requirements, explain our data and present insights to customers.
Mentor and support team members in analytics best practices, raising the analytics IQ of the customer success and product teams.


Qualifications


Has 3+ years of experience in product, client reporting analytics or a related field.
Has strong storytelling skills with a track record of presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Is highly skilled in SQL and has 2+ years of experience using BI Tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.).
Can easily connect analytics solutions to business outcomes.
Has strong problem-solving skills, with an ability to come to rigorous and defensible solutions to complex and open-ended problems.
Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills.
Has a passion for DataCamp's mission of data and AI literacy.


Why Datacamp?

Joining DataCamp means becoming part of a dynamic, creative, and international start-up. Here are just a few of the reasons why you'll love being on our team:


Exciting challenges: Face new technical challenges daily, keeping your work engaging and rewarding.
Competitive compensation: We offer a competitive salary with attractive benefits.
Flexibility: Benefit from flexible working hours because the future is flexible!
Continuous learning: Access a yearly learning budget for conferences & training to support your professional growth.
Global retreats: Participate in international company retreats, fostering a global team spirit.
Equipment: Yearly refreshment of your IT Equipment budget for your home working setup.
Amazing team: Collaborate with a truly exceptional team—seriously, we're awesome!


Our competitive compensation package offers additional benefits. On top of your salary you will also receive extra legal benefits such as best-in-class medical insurance including dental and vision. Depending on your location additional benefits might be available to you.

At DataCamp, we value diverse experiences and perspectives. If you're excited about this role but don't meet every qualification, we still encourage you to apply. We believe skills can be developed and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Your unique talents and perspectives are what make our team great!
Show more

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/x)
Description:
Ti piacerebbe lavorare come Data Engineer nella Direzione IT di BNL?

Entrare a far parte di BNL Gruppo BNP Paribas, significa lavorare in una delle principali banche italiane, parte di un Gruppo internazionale leader europeo nei servizi bancari e finanziari, presente in 64 paesi con circa 184.000 collaboratori.

Significa quindi lavorare in un ambiente sfidante, con una cultura internazionale e fortemente orientato all’innovazione.




Cosa fa la struttura IT Data Platform

La Direzione IT è responsabile funzionalmente delle strutture IT delle società del Gruppo BNL BC e coordina la comunità IT del Gruppo BNPP in Italia con l’obiettivo di ottenere tutte le possibili sinergie di scopo, assicurare piena consistenza operativa ed abilitare la trasformazione digitale del nostro Gruppo

Nell’ambito della Direzione IT di BNL, la Data Intelligence Platform si occupa di definire ed implementare la strategia tecnologica della Banca in termini di Analytics, Business Intelligence, Artificial Intelligence e Data Management.

Il gruppo ha quindi la responsabilità di evolvere e mantenere operativa l’architettura dati al servizio delle Analytics, nonché di realizzare soluzioni di reporting e dashboarding direzionale.

Il gruppo Data Intelligence Platform ha anche la responsabilità di costruire soluzioni di Advanced Analytics e Artificial Intelligence, ed integrarle con i sistemi Banca, rendendole pienamente parte dei processi aziendali.







Cosa farai concretamente?




Come Data Engineer sarai parte del team Data Intelligence Platform sarai coinvolto in attività di disegno, implementazione ed evoluzione di soluzioni e2e in ambito Data & Analytics.

Svolgerai queste attività al servizio delle diverse aree di business di BNL, in un contesto dinamico, collaborativo e multidisciplinare.

L’ecosistema tecnologico di riferimento è molto ampio, e va dalle piattaforme tradizionali di Datawarehouse ed ETL (DataStage, Teradata etc.), alle tecnologie di Analytics e Reporting (esempio: Microsoft PowerBI), per arrivare fino alle tecnologie di Big Data (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka etc) e Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence (es. Python).

Sarai coinvolto anche in iniziative innovative di trasformazione tecnologica, a partire dalle fasi di studio e prototipazione.




Il/la candidato/a ideale:




· Ha passione per le tematiche legate al mondo Data & Analytics

· Ha naturale orientamento all’innovazione ed alla trasformazione

· È abile nella capacità di sintesi/semplificazione

· Organizza le attività per priorità e gestisce con facilità gli imprevisti

· Lavora bene in gruppo in ottica collaborativa










Il/la candidato/a ideale ha alcune delle seguenti competenze:




· Architetture Dati e di Analytics

· Modellazione Dati e strumenti di ETL (DataStage, Microsoft SSIS, etc..)

· Conosce il linguaggio SQL per l’interrogazione delle basi dati (idealmente in ambiente Teradata)

· Strumenti di Analisi e Reporting (Tableau, PowerBI, etc…)

· Linguaggi di programmazione ML/AI (Python, R)

· Tecnologie dell’universo “Big Data” (Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, NoSQL)

· Buona conoscenza della Lingua inglese, livello B2







Il background del/la candidato/a ideale:




· Ha conseguito la Laurea magistrale in discipline scientifiche (Ingegneria Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, o similari)

· Possibilmente ha 3/5 anni di esperienza in ambito Data & Analytics







La nostra offerta:




Il contratto previsto è a tempo indeterminato, la retribuzione segue quanto previsto dal Contratto Collettivo Nazionale del Credito ed è commisurata al livello di esperienza maturata







Sede di lavoro




Roma in modalità di lavoro ibrida







In un mondo che cambia, la diversità e l'inclusione sono valori fondamentali. BNP Paribas offre pari opportunità di lavoro a tutti i candidati idonei e si impegna attivamente a garantire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo in cui tutte le diversità siano valorizzate. Insieme, costruiamo la banca del domani: innovativa, responsabile e sostenibile.







Il presente annuncio si rivolge a candidati di ambo i sessi (D.Lgs. 198/2006, Codice Pari Opportunità)

Show more

Sede di lavoro


Roma in modalità di lavoro ibrida



In un mondo che cambia, la diversità e l'inclusione sono valori fondamentali. BNP Paribas offre pari opportunità di lavoro a tutti i candidati idonei e si impegna attivamente a garantire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo in cui tutte le diversità siano valorizzate. Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Hirevo Office Roma, divisione di Gi Group per la ricerca e selezione di profili specializzati, ricerca per importante azienda cliente del settore automotive:

1 junior Data analyst

La risorsa sarà inserita nel reparto Marketing, VLV & Sales Process.

ATTIVITA’:

Analisi dati di mercato e del trend delle performance aziendali/di prodotto;

Sviluppo analisi statistica delle performance aziendali/di prodotto/di processo;

Supporto produzione ed aggiornamento report di analisi numeriche per le attività di marketing.

TECHNICAL & SOFT SKILLS:

Laurea in matematica/statistica (preferibile) o economia

Conoscenza avanzata del pacchetto office ed excel in particolare

Competenze in Data analysis

Conoscenza di sql server (preferibile)

Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese

Proattività e capacità di lavorare in team

Doti di precisione ed accuratezza

Si valutano profili neolaureati o con breve esperienza affine

Si offre contratto a tempo determinato con prospettiva

Luogo di lavoro : Roma Sud ( è necessario essere automuniti)

Orario di lavoro : full time. E' previsto smart working

Facciamo parte di Gi Group Holding (www.gigroupholding.it) la prima multinazionale italiana del lavoro e una tra le principali realtà che offrono servizi e consulenza HR a livello globale. Il nostro Gruppo è attivo nei seguenti campi: Temporary, Permanent e Professional Staffing, Ricerca e Selezione di Profili Manageriali, Executive Search, Outsourcing, Formazione, Consulenza HR, Amministrazione HR, Employability, Transizione e Sviluppo di Carriera. Siamo presenti in più di 37 Paesi in Europa, Asia e America con un team di oltre 9.000 persone.

I valori che ci contraddistinguono: attenzione, collaborazione, passione, sostenibilità, apprendimento continuo e innovazione, responsabilità.

Consulta tutti i nostri annunci su www.gigroup.it

Gi Group S.p.A. è autorizzata ad operare dal Ministero del Lavoro (Aut. Min. 26/11/2004 PROT. 1101 - SG).

L’offerta si intende rivolta a candidati ambosessi, nel rispetto del D.Lgs. n. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii. e dei Decreti Legislativi n. 215 e n. 216 del 2003 sulle parità di trattamento. I candidati sono invitati a leggere l’informativa privacy ai sensi degli artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. EU 679/2016 al seguente indirizzo www.gigroup.it/privacy-candidati

Title: Consultant - Data Analyst Financial Services
Description:
The chance to build a better future is right in front of you.

Do Work That Matters - Il tuo ruolo e le tue responsabilità

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l’opportunità di aiutare i clienti, la società, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide più attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonché supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.

Business Performance Services è la linea di servizi di KPMG Advisory SpA che supporta i propri clienti nell’analisi delle opportunità di innovazione e trasformazione dei propri modelli di business. Nell’ambito dei Financial Services si occupa anche dello studio e delle evoluzioni di tali modelli per supportare le istituzioni finanziarie nella trasformazione dell’ecosistema e per gestire come un’opportunità e non una minaccia l’ingresso di nuovi attori nell’arena competitiva, in particolare le Fintech, e dai nuovi paradigmi di servizio incentrati sulla Customer Experience.

In tale contesto ricerchiamo per la sede di Roma un Consultant / Senior Consultant con esperienza nell’analisi dati del mondo finanziario (banche e assicurazioni) che, attraverso le loro indagini, possano supportare il top management nelle strategie data driven.

In concreto ti occuperai di:


Progettare database per scopi analitici;
Analizzare e integrare fonti di dati;
Progettare KPI e framework di calcolo più efficienti;
Analizzare, progettare e implementare modelli di reportistica e dashboard di monitoraggio;
Analizzare processi aziendali e progettare modelli di supporto analitico;
Analisi di processi aziendali e implementazione di soluzioni analitiche attraverso l’identificazione delle opportunità di evoluzione ed innovazione dei modelli distributivi e di servizio;
Analisi e integrazione di dati per la definizione di modelli di business e delle strutture organizzative.


Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunità è perfetta per te se:


Esperienza pregressa nel ruolo 1-2 anni;
Laurea magistrale in discipline economiche;
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese;
Ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office;
Completano il profilo spiccate abilità di lavorare per obiettivi e forte attitudine al problem solving, buone doti comunicative e relazionali, focus sul cliente, entusiasmo ed elevata motivazione alla crescita professionale e al cambiamento, proattività, naturale propensione al lavoro in team e disponibilità a frequenti viaggi e trasferte.


Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG


Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversità
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creatività e il lavoro di squadra
Modalità di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Mindset internazionale e progettualità innovative
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico


Together for Better – I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualità, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunità, integrità: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all’impegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformità del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversità e l’Inclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parità di genere. All’interno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni concrete che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG .

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunità.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst | Reporting Specialist (rif.1044)
Description:
Per consolidata azienda operante nel settore farmaceutico, stiamo selezionando un Data Analyst da inserire nel team interno per analizzare i dati operativi e contribuire al miglioramento continuo dei processi, con un focus particolare sull'efficienza e sulla sostenibilità.




La persona individuata, nell’ambito della struttura IT, svolgerà indicativamente le seguenti attività:

Raccolta delle esigenze in ambito reporting
Raccolta, pulizia e analisi dei dati
Scrittura di query SQL per estrazione, filtraggio e aggregazione dei dati
Creazione di report e dashboard
Utilizzo di strumenti di visualizzazione dei dati




Requisiti richiesti:

Esperienza nell’estrazione di informazioni da database
Conoscenza dei database relazionali
Familiarità con data model complessi
Esperienza nella scrittura di query SQL
Conoscenza di SQL Server




Requisiti opzionali:

Conoscenza di strumenti di reporting
Abilità nella preparazione di dashboard interattive




Completano il profilo curiosità, doti comunicative e relazionali, attitudine al problem solving, predisposizione al team working e alla condivisione.




Sede di lavoro: Roma con possibilità di smart working. L'azienda offre assunzione a tempo indeterminato.




EgoValeo è una società che offre servizi di ricerca e selezione del personale (Autorizzata a TI prot. 39/0014503), supporto alla ricollocazione professionale (Autorizzata a TI prot. 39/0014481), formazione, coaching e consulenza in ambito risorse umane.




EgoValeo è la prima società di head hunting specializzata unicamente in profili Information Technology e Engineering.




Gli interessati (UOMINI e DONNE L.903/77) possono inviare un dettagliato curriculum vitae ad EgoValeo. EgoValeo, Titolare del trattamento, tratterà i dati elettronicamente al solo fine della ricerca e selezione del personale. Si invita ad omettere i dati particolari. I dati potranno essere comunicati alle aziende ns. clienti. Per prendere visione dell’informativa completa e dei propri diritti ai sensi del Regolamento UE 2016/679, visitare il sito internet di EgoValeo.

Show more

Title: Operations and Data Analyst Intern - for a Health & Wellness Fast-Growing Start
Description:
About our Client:


Our client is transforming the way people manage their health through personalised vitamins and supplements.
They are committed to creating solutions that are data-driven and customer-centric, using advanced technology to deliver the best possible health outcomes
As an intern, you'll have the opportunity to work with a dynamic team in a fast-growing startup, gaining hands-on experience across different functions of their business


About the Role:

In this role you will work closely with our client's Head of Operations and cross-functional teams including operations, marketing and tech teams. You will provide vital support in optimising their tech platform, analysing data, and ensuring the smooth operation of their CRM and analytics tools.


Data Analysis & Reporting: Support the analysis of customer, operational, and marketing data, create dynamic dashboards, and help track KPIs across the business
Tech Support & QA: Assist in tech platform projects, conduct quality assurance on new features, troubleshoot issues, and support low-code application enhancements
Marketing Technology (CRM) Support: Help optimise CRM tools for personalised campaigns, assist in campaign testing and setup, and analyse performance metrics
Operational Process Improvement: Collaborate with teams to streamline processes, identify inefficiencies, and implement data-driven improvements


More Info:


Duration: 6 months
Work Type: Preferably full-time, but part-time (minimum 3 days per week) is also an option
Start date: Mid-January 2025
Location: Sydney
Work arrangement: Hybrid
A monthly allowance will be provided to reimburse some expenses during internship



Requirements

About You:


Currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor's degree in Engineering, DataScience, Computer Science, or a related field
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, Google Sheets, or other analytics Software
Basic understanding of tech platforms and an interest in learning more about tech
operations
Strong problem-solving skills with a data-driven mindset
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Strong attention to detail, organisational skills, and a proactive attitude
Experience with big data preparation and visualisation is a plus
Basic coding skills (e.g., SQL, Python) is a plus
Familiarity with CRM tools (e.g., Insider) is a plus
Show more

Title: Junior Data Engineer Consultant | Roma
HTML:
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l’opportunità di aiutare i clienti, la società, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide più attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonché supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.

Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse di Torino.

La Lighthouse è il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalità e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti dell'ingegneria dei dati, con un forte focus sulla progettazione delle informazioni e visualizzazione dei dati. Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacità di interpretare e gestire i dati.

Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:

  • Progettare database per scopi analitici;
  • Analizzare e integrare fonti di dati;
  • Progettare KPI e i framework di calcolo più efficienti;
  • Analizzare, progettare e implementare modelli di reporting e dashboard di monitoraggio;
  • Analizzare processi aziendali e progettare modelli di supporto analitico;
  • Implementare soluzioni analitiche, supportare il go-live e gestire la manutenzione delle applicazioni.

Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunità è perfetta per te se:

  • Possiedi una Laurea in economia, matematica, ingegneria matematica, statistica, ingegneria informatica, ingegneria gestionale o informatica;
  • Hai sviluppato la capacità di combinare competenze aziendali con competenze IT, inclusa la modellazione dei dati;
  • Hai sviluppato Interesse per la business intelligence/data analytics;
  • Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero;
  • Possiedi conoscenza di almeno uno dei seguenti database (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) e hai sviluppato competenze in SQL; la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione rappresenta un vantaggio.

Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG

  • Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversità;
  • Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creatività e il lavoro di squadra;
  • Modalità di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale;
  • Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati;
  • Mindset internazionale e progettualità innovative;
  • Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico.

Together for Better – I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualità, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunità, integrità: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all’impegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformità del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversità e l’Inclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parità di genere. All’interno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni concrete che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Google
Description:
Entra nel nostro mondo.
Trasforma insieme a noi.

Business Intelligence Analyst
Quale sarà la tua sfida?
Supporterai la delivery tecnica ed applicativa dei progetti in ambito Business Intelligence, svolgendo attività di analisi e sviluppo ed utilizzando tecnologie di Data Visualization, nell’ambito di progettualità o in modalità a servizio presso i nostri clienti.
Sarai coinvolto/a in attività di raccolta ed analisi dei business requirement, analizzando consistenza e accuratezza dei requisiti. Analizzerai le fonti dati implementando servizi di progettazione dati con competenza e metodologia in ambito Data Modeling.
Svilupperai sistemi di analisi delle performance, report interattivi e
dashboard analitiche con tecnologie come QlikView, QlikSense, Tableau, PowerBI, SAP BO per elaborare le analisi e rappresentare i risultati, implementando le metriche più efficaci al fine di costruire validi strumenti di supporto alle decisioni di business.
Tra le tue responsabilità potranno anche esserci l’estrazione e rappresentazione sintetica di analisi complesse realizzate da altre figure professionali (es. Data Scientist, Data Governance expert, Data Architect, Data Project Manager).
Ti sarà richiesto, in modo commisurato alla tua seniority, di dimostrare ed evolvere le capacità di costruire relazioni con clienti, vendor di tecnologie, partner, assicurare il raggiungimento della migliore elaborazione dei risultati delle tue analisi comunicandoli efficacemente a colleghi e Clienti e, per finire, il coordinamento di analisti/e più junior all’interno di team articolati.
Sarai tu ad entrare nel nostro Team?
Requisiti Indispensabili:
- Laurea Specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Ingegneria delle Telecomunicazioni, Informatica, Statistica, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini (STEM)
- Esperienza pregressa in almeno una tecnologia di Data Visualization (e.g. Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikSense) o in processi di estrazione, pulizia, modellazione e analisi dati, con strumenti tipici del settore (quali MS Excel, SQL, SAS e Python);
- Ottima conoscenza e competenza in ambito SQL
- Analisi funzionali in ambito dati e IT;
- Conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese
Plus:
- Capacità di realizzare stored procedure e SQL function
- MS Excel avanzato (VBA programming)
- SAS Base/Guide, Python, R, Java, C++, Javascript/HTML, PHP
- Esperienza in progetti che utilizzano modelli di AI (Gemini, OpenAI, altro) che servono a generare insights dei dati.
Soft Skills:
- Standing consulenziale
- Ottime doti relazionali e comunicative
- Orientamento al cliente e al raggiungimento degli obiettivi
- Buona attitudine a lavorare in team
- Precisione e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze
- Disponibilità per trasferte in Italia e all’estero
Perchè Bip?
People at the center of our culture
Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialità e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.
Lavorare in BIP è un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.
Challenge yourself
Avrai la possibilità di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attività e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l’autonomia e la capacità di assumerti responsabilità e metterti in gioco.
Unlocking your potential
Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all’avanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.
Work-life Integration
Troverai una policy che supporta lo smartworking fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

Valorizziamo l’unicità e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutte le nostre persone abbiano pari opportunità di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.

Il nostro approccio alla diversità e all’inclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrità e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, più ampi.

Promuoviamo l’inserimento e l’integrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette – in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99

Next Steps
Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.
Se c’è un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all’interno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.
L’iter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.
L’ordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.
In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunità future.
Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.
Su di Noi
Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l’esperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l’innovazione e la digitalizzazione.
Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 4500 professionisti e professioniste, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze più all’avanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.
Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualità su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.
Crediamo nel valore dell’eccellenza, che è la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.
Show more
HTML:
Entra nel nostro mondo.
Trasforma insieme a noi.

Business Intelligence Analyst
Quale sarà la tua sfida?
Supporterai la delivery tecnica ed applicativa dei progetti in ambito Business Intelligence, svolgendo attività di analisi e sviluppo ed utilizzando tecnologie di Data Visualization, nell’ambito di progettualità o in modalità a servizio presso i nostri clienti.
Sarai coinvolto/a in attività di raccolta ed analisi dei business requirement, analizzando consistenza e accuratezza dei requisiti. Analizzerai le fonti dati implementando servizi di progettazione dati con competenza e metodologia in ambito Data Modeling.
Svilupperai sistemi di analisi delle performance, report interattivi e
dashboard analitiche con tecnologie come QlikView, QlikSense, Tableau, PowerBI, SAP BO per elaborare le analisi e rappresentare i risultati, implementando le metriche più efficaci al fine di costruire validi strumenti di supporto alle decisioni di business.
Tra le tue responsabilità potranno anche esserci l’estrazione e rappresentazione sintetica di analisi complesse realizzate da altre figure professionali (es. Data Scientist, Data Governance expert, Data Architect, Data Project Manager).
Ti sarà richiesto, in modo commisurato alla tua seniority, di dimostrare ed evolvere le capacità di costruire relazioni con clienti, vendor di tecnologie, partner, assicurare il raggiungimento della migliore elaborazione dei risultati delle tue analisi comunicandoli efficacemente a colleghi e Clienti e, per finire, il coordinamento di analisti/e più junior all’interno di team articolati.
Sarai tu ad entrare nel nostro Team?
Requisiti Indispensabili:
- Laurea Specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Ingegneria delle Telecomunicazioni, Informatica, Statistica, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini (STEM)
- Esperienza pregressa in almeno una tecnologia di Data Visualization (e.g. Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikSense) o in processi di estrazione, pulizia, modellazione e analisi dati, con strumenti tipici del settore (quali MS Excel, SQL, SAS e Python);
- Ottima conoscenza e competenza in ambito SQL
- Analisi funzionali in ambito dati e IT;
- Conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese
Plus:
- Capacità di realizzare stored procedure e SQL function
- MS Excel avanzato (VBA programming)
- SAS Base/Guide, Python, R, Java, C++, Javascript/HTML, PHP
- Esperienza in progetti che utilizzano modelli di AI (Gemini, OpenAI, altro) che servono a generare insights dei dati.
Soft Skills:
- Standing consulenziale
- Ottime doti relazionali e comunicative
- Orientamento al cliente e al raggiungimento degli obiettivi
- Buona attitudine a lavorare in team
- Precisione e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze
- Disponibilità per trasferte in Italia e all’estero
Perchè Bip?
People at the center of our culture
Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialità e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.
Lavorare in BIP è un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.
